commit_message:
Fixing bug when filtering blacklists

The code in cli/main.py that was meant to construct a profile from
the CLI test/skip options was broken. This replaces it and cleans
up some of the testing around the CLI. It also makes the profile
logic in the manager simpler.

Closes-bug: #1548525
Change-Id: I095179032a24a4d1c6ca33c71b973699e08acaf4

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-19 20:44:54.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_odl/common/filters.py'], 'message': "bug work around of Java MOXy bug of 475475

On port creation with dns_name: None, null pointer exception occurs
in opendaylight. This is due to the following bug
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=475475
EClipsLink MOXy is used as json parser and it wrongly parses json
and stores wrongly null. In order to work around it, networking-odl
shouldn't send unmapped keys whose value is null.

Closes-Bug: #1546848
Change-Id: I1efce0bfb8f943177a7f3e9555f038f13b3ac2a9
"}]
commit_message:
bug work around of Java MOXy bug of 475475

On port creation with dns_name: None, null pointer exception occurs
in opendaylight. This is due to the following bug
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=475475
EClipsLink MOXy is used as json parser and it wrongly parses json
and stores wrongly null. In order to work around it, networking-odl
shouldn't send unmapped keys whose value is null.

Closes-Bug: #1546848
Change-Id: I1efce0bfb8f943177a7f3e9555f038f13b3ac2a9

commit_message:
Opendaylight L3 service plugin refactor to handle out of sync issues

This commits refactors the Opendaylight L3 service plugin to handle race
conditions and out of sync issues. It attempts to address these using an
atomic thread synchronization model that tracks the sync, retry, success
and failed states of Neutron objects sent to Opendaylight.

Partial-Bug: #1493551

Change-Id: I8664e05a5294a1ba3e455a9b31ea984621c02f8a

commit_message:
Timestamps out of sync in the V2 driver

This commit fixes the issue where the created_at and last_retried
timestamps would be severely out of sync when a journal row
was created.

Closes-Bug: #1541024

Change-Id: I0433b4f5d7981aacbb6e77cf9a8fb75d0da1275a

subject: Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 08:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2
(cherry picked from commit 3aefa43072d9453412376a9bdedd949e03c926a5)
"}]
commit_message:
Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2
(cherry picked from commit 3aefa43072d9453412376a9bdedd949e03c926a5)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-15 22:51:56.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Check Keystone init before running it

It turns out that os-cloud-config is smart enough to not re-create
Keystone resources if they already exist, which means the previous
check for whether Puppet had already initialized it didn't work.

As an alternative, explicitly check whether the nova user has been
created before running init.  If it does already exist, then don't
even run the Keystone init.

Some refactoring was also done to enable easier unit testing of the
change.

Change-Id: Ifa741aaa9f2c60e82272e3d855c57f36834d2220
"}]
commit_message:
Check Keystone init before running it

It turns out that os-cloud-config is smart enough to not re-create
Keystone resources if they already exist, which means the previous
check for whether Puppet had already initialized it didn't work.

As an alternative, explicitly check whether the nova user has been
created before running init.  If it does already exist, then don't
even run the Keystone init.

Some refactoring was also done to enable easier unit testing of the
change.

Change-Id: Ifa741aaa9f2c60e82272e3d855c57f36834d2220

subject: Set max_resources_per_stack to -1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 17:56:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Set max_resources_per_stack to -1

The max_resources_per_stack configuration option for Heat engine is
meant to prevent DOS attacks by large stacks. For TripleO, the check
itself is actually quite resource instensive since it takes a while to
actually count the resources in all the nested stacks.

The tenant in the undercloud is trusted anyway.

Setting the option to -1 disables the check and makes a significant
improvement in overcloud deployment time.

Change-Id: Id5a36947d2dfa77fba9f90eb0e5be3eb27592696
(cherry picked from commit a0ea79ada1d2a557c9f701e3b3bf0be71fb9f061)
'}]
commit_message:
Set max_resources_per_stack to -1

The max_resources_per_stack configuration option for Heat engine is
meant to prevent DOS attacks by large stacks. For TripleO, the check
itself is actually quite resource instensive since it takes a while to
actually count the resources in all the nested stacks.

The tenant in the undercloud is trusted anyway.

Setting the option to -1 disables the check and makes a significant
improvement in overcloud deployment time.

Change-Id: Id5a36947d2dfa77fba9f90eb0e5be3eb27592696
(cherry picked from commit a0ea79ada1d2a557c9f701e3b3bf0be71fb9f061)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-19 05:31:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_transfer.py', 'cinder/transfer/api.py'], 'message': "Handle OverQuota exception during volume transfer

Cinder doesn't correctly handle OverQuota during volume
transfer. It only checks quota volumes and gigabytes,
and ignores quotas in volume type. As a result, when it
exceeds volumes and gigabytes of a volume type, Cinder doesn't
raise exception and allows accept move on.

This patch is to check every over quota in overs and fixes the
problem.

Change-Id: I02ef576ecb3052724bc14a3bd2df842bec554e0d
Closes-bug: #1539459
"}]
commit_message:
Handle OverQuota exception during volume transfer

Cinder doesn't correctly handle OverQuota during volume
transfer. It only checks quota volumes and gigabytes,
and ignores quotas in volume type. As a result, when it
exceeds volumes and gigabytes of a volume type, Cinder doesn't
raise exception and allows accept move on.

This patch is to check every over quota in overs and fixes the
problem.

Change-Id: I02ef576ecb3052724bc14a3bd2df842bec554e0d
Closes-bug: #1539459

commit_message:
Not allowing empty app names

Currently Solum is accepting apps with
empty app name attribute. This patch
adds a check for this and rejects such
requests.

Change-Id: Id13ef88c1f3e8777ffbafda5a1490a0195ea9d0c
Closes-Bug: #1526708

commit_message:
Add debug message about file hash calculation

When debugging image uploads, it can seem like shade has hung when it's
in fact calculating file hashes. Emit a debug message to indicate this
has been done.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-26 14:29:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/transition_to_osc.rst'], 'message': 'Devref Update: Transition to OpenStack Client

Update the "Transition to OpenStack Client" devref with information
about the new OSC command specs process. This process can be used
to propose new networking commands while deferring their
implementation. This process may help speed the overall transition
to OSC.

This update also includes information about the OSC neutron support
etherpad which provides detailed status for the transition.

And finally, updates were made to the overall transition plan
based on discussions at the midcycle.

Change-Id: I46bc066d2169a1e20af13baac7131ffa2eedd7c8
Related-Bug: #1521291
'}]
commit_message:
Devref Update: Transition to OpenStack Client

Update the "Transition to OpenStack Client" devref with information
about the new OSC command specs process. This process can be used
to propose new networking commands while deferring their
implementation. This process may help speed the overall transition
to OSC.

This update also includes information about the OSC neutron support
etherpad which provides detailed status for the transition.

And finally, updates were made to the overall transition plan
based on discussions at the midcycle.

Change-Id: I46bc066d2169a1e20af13baac7131ffa2eedd7c8
Related-Bug: #1521291

commit_message:
Adds training-labs post jobs to publish tarballs

Adding training labs post jobs to publish tar/zip to
tarball.openstack.org. This should allow training-labs team to
automatically publish tarballs/zip files for the end-users of this
project and provide direct links from docs.openstack.org/training-labs
landing page.

Change-Id: I5dee9c7188b8b0cfd1bad31f320cc787eae5dcfa

commit_message:
Replace HTTP 'magic numbers' with constants

Replace HTTP 'magic numbers' (also known as unnamed numerical constants)
with constants provided by the http_client/httplib library.

For example, use 'http_client.OK' instead of '200'

Change-Id: I7fc70ec0c5fee128054c026a78671d07c48d5eaf

commit_message:
Restore the authorized_keys file in 'cobbler' container

SSH restore must go before Cobbler restore to ensure
that /etc/cobbler/authorized_keys file is updated
with appropriate public key.

Change-Id: Ie9493e883885cfc167920bfe35d5545d05c378e9
Closes-bug: 1551339
(cherry picked from commit f78d006175cf9c158d3c196702b1db1a4d234ddf)

commit_message:
Implement base configuration for independent repository

This patch establishes the base repository configuration required for the
role to pass CI checks and be usable in  OpenStack-CI.

It also implements a callback plugin to provide human readable logging for
functional tests in order to aid the resolution of any functional testing
failures.

Change-Id: I6a9782ef185a263e1891d8dbfe15cb8bec10ef76

subject: Remove admin role in admin tenant from ceilometer
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-06 15:56:18.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/keystone.py'], 'message': "Remove admin role in admin tenant from ceilometer

We don't need to grant the ceilometer user the admin role in the admin
tenant any longer. The admin role in the service tenant is sufficient,
as long as ceilometer is configured to use the service tenant. The
Depends-On patches make the switch to the ceilometer configuration to
use the service tenant.

As part of this change, the ResellerAdmin role is also added to the
ceilometer user in the service tenant. Previously, the ResellerAdmin
role was created, but never granted to the ceilometer user.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: I19f7b3aa156ff879fd1c9521bc9e172c27a3d6b7
Partial-Bug: #1358237

commit_message:
Remove admin role in admin tenant from ceilometer

We don't need to grant the ceilometer user the admin role in the admin
tenant any longer. The admin role in the service tenant is sufficient,
as long as ceilometer is configured to use the service tenant. The
Depends-On patches make the switch to the ceilometer configuration to
use the service tenant.

As part of this change, the ResellerAdmin role is also added to the
ceilometer user in the service tenant. Previously, the ResellerAdmin
role was created, but never granted to the ceilometer user.

This brings the ceilometer configuration in line with the
recommendations from the official installation guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/yum/content/ceilometer-controller-install.html

Change-Id: I19f7b3aa156ff879fd1c9521bc9e172c27a3d6b7
Partial-Bug: #1358237
Depends-On: I40dd4543580332a46cde96f4bca639eb777ac7a8
Depends-On: Ia14695eb23a1ff551fd27f74b4cb864e80b100e3

commit_message:
Remove unneeded version string check in CDH plugin

CDH v5 converts the complete version name, from '5' to '5.0.0'.
But it is useless for CDH v5.3.0, v5.4.0, v5.5.0. Remove them
respectively

Change-Id: Ib8f0ea4220b3a9413ac5263a7ac4a7f35d440472
Closes-Bug: #1550126

commit_message:
Update tempest tests after tempest-lib deprecation

Latest tempest code doesn't using tempest-lib anymore. Tempest-lib
project now marked for deprecation. Tempest-lib code now lives in
tempest repository and to avoid any Import errors connected with
tempest-lib we should update our tempest tests.

- This patch replaces all insertions of tempest_lib to tempest.lib

Change-Id: I7c5f280196052da24535d4cef3bb0ab4ab9310e2
Closes-Bug: #1551863

commit_message:
Explicitly select the version of testtools and fixtures

Some components [oslo.concurrency] in the gate install wrong fixtures
version that is incompatible with kilo. To enforce the correct version,
moving the dependency into requirements.txt before the oslo library.

Related-Bug: 1542984

commit_message:
Roll up static Heat envs into CI directory

As we've started testing more features we have grown some static
Heat environments that are specific to CI.  Instead of generating
these inline in the CI scripts, let's just check them into the
repo as standalone files and copy them to the undercloud for its
use.

Note that although there are only two such files right now, I will
almost certainly need more for testing overcloud SSL, and it seems
likely that as TripleO adds features we will have a need to
add more test environment files to CI.

I've also reordered this commit before the network isolation one
that will use the net-iso.yaml file because I think we need to do
some additional configuration for that and it makes more sense to
just do it in the standalone files right away.

Change-Id: Ia73db99c24637b8c9ca02848141597e8ecfa3881

commit_message:
Ajax errors should return correctly.

Currently, any ajax call that hits an error other than NotAuthorized or
NotAuthenticated the end-response returned will likely be a 500 error
with all the html of our ISE page included.

Richard Jones's API code already provides a way to handle these issues,
so we should use that!

Change-Id: I508673e8d8d5ba5650d3e5b2896865020223ec3d
Closes-Bug: #1489905

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 6635, 'name': 'John Davidge', 'email': 'john.davidge@rackspace.com', 'username': 'john-davidge'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 8873, 'name': 'Assaf Muller', 'email': 'amuller@redhat.com', 'username': 'amuller'}, {'_account_id': 17211, 'name': 'Brandon Palm', 'email': 'bapalm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'bapalm'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-02-29 23:43:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/purge.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_purge.py', 'neutronclient/tests/functional/core/test_purge.py', 'neutronclient/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-neutron-purge-a89e3d1179dce4b1.yaml'], 'message': "Support cleanup of tenant resources with a single API call

The addition of the 'neutron purge' command allows cloud admins
to conveniently delete multiple neutron resources associated
with a given tenant.

The command will delete all supported resources provided that
they can be deleted (not in use, etc) and feedback the amount
of each resource deleted to the user. A completion percentage
is also given to keep the user informed of progress.

Currently supports deletion of:

Networks
Subnets (implicitly)
Routers
Ports (including router interfaces)
Floating IPs
Security Groups

This feature can be easily extended to support more resource
types in the future.

DocImpact: Update API documentation to describe neutron-purge usage

Change-Id: I5a366d3537191045eb53f9cccd8cd0f7ce54a63b
Closes-Bug: 1511574
Partially-Implements: blueprint tenant-delete
"}]
commit_message:
Support cleanup of tenant resources with a single API call

The addition of the 'neutron purge' command allows cloud admins
to conveniently delete multiple neutron resources associated
with a given tenant.

The command will delete all supported resources provided that
they can be deleted (not in use, etc) and feedback the amount
of each resource deleted to the user. A completion percentage
is also given to keep the user informed of progress.

Currently supports deletion of:

Networks
Subnets (implicitly)
Routers
Ports (including router interfaces)
Floating IPs
Security Groups

This feature can be easily extended to support more resource
types in the future.

DocImpact: Update API documentation to describe neutron-purge usage

Change-Id: I5a366d3537191045eb53f9cccd8cd0f7ce54a63b
Closes-Bug: 1511574
Partially-Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

commit_message:
fix migration from v1.3 to v2.0

previous tests never really tested migration, it just took a v2.0
TimeSerieArchive and changed to v2.0 AggregatedTimeSerie. this
changes it so we take v1.3  TimeSerieArchive and convert it to V2.0
AggregatedTimeSerie.

Related-Bug: #1548367

Change-Id: I8eea10912517b1b0a77ad7c1a3c9037d00bf1960

subject: Assign parent_stack during validation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-18 09:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Assign parent_stack during validation

This patch is to fix call resource_facade failed.
The root cause is that call Stack.parent_resource failed,
because nest stack's _parent_stack is None in stack validation phase.

The call stack is as follow:
---------------------------------------------------
 EngineService.create_stack
 ->EngineService._parse_template_and_validate_stack
   ->Stack.validate
     ->TemplateResource.validate
       ->StackResource.validate
         ->StackResource.validate_nested_stack
           ->StackResource._parse_nested_stack
             ->parser.Stack
---------------------------------------------------
a) Here a nest stack is created, but the own_id is None.
b) Then when continue the nest stack, it will finally
call Stack.parent_resource, which will raise an exception
because the nest stack's _parent_stack member is None.

Change-Id: I0a886265a22a2a93e2bf286005e0e7ef7a6f498f
Closes-Bug: #1491146
"}]
commit_message:
Assign parent_stack during validation

This patch is to fix call resource_facade failed.
The root cause is that call Stack.parent_resource failed,
because nest stack's _parent_stack is None in stack validation phase.

The call stack is as follow:
---------------------------------------------------
 EngineService.create_stack
 ->EngineService._parse_template_and_validate_stack
   ->Stack.validate
     ->TemplateResource.validate
       ->StackResource.validate
         ->StackResource.validate_nested_stack
           ->StackResource._parse_nested_stack
             ->parser.Stack
---------------------------------------------------
a) Here a nest stack is created, but the own_id is None.
b) Then when continue the nest stack, it will finally
call Stack.parent_resource, which will raise an exception
because the nest stack's _parent_stack member is None.

Change-Id: I0a886265a22a2a93e2bf286005e0e7ef7a6f498f
Closes-Bug: #1491146

commit_message:
[Image] Check return value is None in image unit tests.

take_action() in commands inheriting from Command returns nothing.
So we should assert the return is None in the unit tests of
these commands.

Change-Id: I237ea772f74fa52af2e9aacd35d4b9cfb225c94c
Partial-Bug: #1550636

commit_message:
Support adding a swap file to overcloud nodes

Create a new SoftwareDeployment that can be used to add a swap file to
all nodes The amount of swap and the location of the swap file can be
customized via parameter_defaults and the swap_size_megabytes/swap_path
parameters.

Change-Id: I1fb14c0fab2255410fceb26c3a7d5cfe0ba57b3b
(cherry picked from commit 570bf5431113db332490e403bb889ed5959876f9)

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-09-01 06:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/hgst.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/nfs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_hgst.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/scaleio.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/aoe.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/fibrechannel.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/iscsi.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/net.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/quobyte.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/smbfs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_scaleio.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/volume.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Force iSCSI disconnect after timeout

Due to the async nature of Libvirt detachDeviceFlags[1] call, nova
libvirt driver shouldn't simply assume device detach always succeeds
when detachDeviceFlags() returns. Instead, it needs to check the domain
XML to verify if the device is really detached or not.

This change added a `libvirt_wait_detach_volume_seconds` option,
so that after this timeout value, libvirt volume driver will try to
force disconnect the volume.

This change depends on os-brick change:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217032/

[1] http://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainDetachDeviceFlags

DocImpact
"wait_detach_volume_seconds" config option is added to allow deployer
to control number of seconds Nova waits for volume to be detached
from VM after libvirt issues detachDeviceFlag() call.  When times
out, Nova would force disconnect volume.

Closes-Bug: #1436561

Change-Id: I8426694774e440638967d2f2ca7eca779fab2db3
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Force iSCSI disconnect after timeout

Due to the async nature of Libvirt detachDeviceFlags[1] call, nova
libvirt driver shouldn't simply assume device detach always succeeds
when detachDeviceFlags() returns. Instead, it needs to check the domain
XML to verify if the device is really detached or not.

This change added a `libvirt_wait_detach_volume_seconds` option,
so that after this timeout value, libvirt volume driver will try to
force disconnect the volume.

This change depends on os-brick change:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217032/

[1] http://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainDetachDeviceFlags

DocImpact
"wait_detach_volume_seconds" config option is added to allow deployer
to control number of seconds Nova waits for volume to be detached
from VM after libvirt issues detachDeviceFlag() call.  When times
out, Nova would force disconnect volume.

Closes-Bug: #1436561

Change-Id: I8426694774e440638967d2f2ca7eca779fab2db3

commit_message:
Delete volumes with snapshots

This adds the 'cascade' parameter to volume delete,
which deletes snapshots along with a volume in
one call.

This is done in the volume manager, and not in
a driver-optimized way, which will be a later
improvement.

Blueprint: del-vols-with-snaps
Change-Id: I33d15b76d4bd0de14c635d404b2c97096c977a58

subject: Fix create_server() with a named network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 19:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/create_server_network_fix-c4a56b31d2850a4b.yaml', 'shade/openstackcloud.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_create_server.py'], 'message': "Fix create_server() with a named network

If 'network' was supplied to create_server() along with an empty
'nics' list, we would never attempt to find the network. The os_server
Ansible module uses the API this way. This treats an empty list the
same as if the 'nics' parameter were never supplied.

Change-Id: Idc844fab2c4c08f158c892104d065e5554ed90f3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix create_server() with a named network

If 'network' was supplied to create_server() along with an empty
'nics' list, we would never attempt to find the network. The os_server
Ansible module uses the API this way. This treats an empty list the
same as if the 'nics' parameter were never supplied.

Change-Id: Idc844fab2c4c08f158c892104d065e5554ed90f3

commit_message:
Make workflow enforce all required fields

This makes the load balancer workflow force all required fields to
be valid before allowing the user to submit. This means that when
creating a new load balancer a listener, pool, and health monitor
are also required.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I7f48c691c653ea8d94f99367730b0771c7ce4485

commit_message:
Fix requirements and tests for python-fuelclient 8.0

* bump pbr version to >=1.6 as it is in global-requirements
* uncomment extras section in setup.cfg as new pbr can handle it now
* turn off "newly" introduced fuzzy command suggestions in cliff for
  tests

Change-Id: I161813b7e25719b6bb19909adfc2d094c5c480ce

commit_message:
Gracefully stop for task based deployment

Instead of classic stop deployment now we stop to
process new tasks, but allow to end already running tasks.

It will give us ability to run tasks again without erasing
nodes.

Also enable task based logging

Change-Id: I23b9222ac86522c0879e5ab3c7554e554df65fcc
Implements: blueprint graceful-stop-restart-deployment

subject: [inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 14:08:54.000000000', 'files': ['templates/inspector_dnsmasq_tftp.erb', 'templates/inspector_dnsmasq_http.erb'], 'message': "[inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf

Introspection naturally happens in large bulks, after which it's inactive.
Small pool for DHCP addresses means that we'll have conflicts due to how
dnsmasq distributes them by default - using hashing. This change tells dnsmasq
to allocate IP addresses sequentially instead to avoid these conflicts.

The drawback of this option is that long-running clients may switch IP
addresses if their lease expires. This is not a concern for short introspection
process.

Change-Id: I0f08609a9f72799ef9f62216041f2b2b9795afd5
(cherry picked from commit dfff2af1472146bf220929d9993ae30b24d269c2)
"}]
commit_message:
[inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf

Introspection naturally happens in large bulks, after which it's inactive.
Small pool for DHCP addresses means that we'll have conflicts due to how
dnsmasq distributes them by default - using hashing. This change tells dnsmasq
to allocate IP addresses sequentially instead to avoid these conflicts.

The drawback of this option is that long-running clients may switch IP
addresses if their lease expires. This is not a concern for short introspection
process.

Change-Id: I0f08609a9f72799ef9f62216041f2b2b9795afd5
(cherry picked from commit dfff2af1472146bf220929d9993ae30b24d269c2)

commit_message:
Add --cascade to volume delete

This adds the --cascade parameter to the volume
delete command.  Using this will call the volume delete
with an additional parameter that deletes snapshots as
part of the same operation.

The name "cascade" is chosen to be somewhat generic,
so that we can extend this if desired in the future.
(And to hint at the terminology from SQL.)

Depends-On: I33d15b76d4bd0de14c635d404b2c97096c977a58
Change-Id: I05ce61e647c43f9a1e6d74444356a76e5d284673
Blueprint: del-vols-with-snaps

commit_message:
Simplify use of secure_proxy_ssl_header

Since secure_proxy_ssl_header has a default, the code using it can
be simplified since there's no need to check if it's not set
anymore.

Also, corrected the " to ' since OpenStack guideline is to prefer '.

Change-Id: I494354062fce99375c38ef3ce710459423bc5ec4

deployment. This status will be able node redeploy.

commit_message:
Gracefully stop for task based deployment

Introduce new node status: stopped, which used for nodes,
where orchestrator was successfully gracefully stopped task
deployment. This status will be able node redeploy.

Also introduced new type of node error_type: stop_deployment
It will be used if gracefully stop on node will be failed
for example, because of timeout. It will be apply automatically
by recevier for nodes in deploying status
if orchestrator return error for stop deployment task

Change-Id: I30d606d7d11d670d1a68ee90b01b932c1543fccc
Implements: blueprint graceful-stop-restart-deployment

commit_message:
Fix keystone.common.wsgi to explicitly use bytes

The WSGI spec says that the body of a response needs to be bytes. This
ensures that we are using bytes in both Python2 and Python3.

bp python3

Change-Id: I40148c2e2e1e517358b64028d335ac27d17323a3

commit_message:
Allow os.walk to follow symlinks

When uploading releases, os.walk is used to search for *tasks.yaml
files, but currently wont follow links in otherwise valid structures.

Change-Id: I83600bd10017549b2b5d2adce742c5dea39c77c6
Closes-bug: #1546319

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-04 21:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['rally/api.py', 'tests/unit/test_api.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/tempest.py', 'tests/unit/verification/test_tempest.py', 'rally/cli/commands/verify.py', 'etc/rally.bash_completion', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_verify.py'], 'message': 'Re-run failed Tempest tests

Add the ability to re-run the tempest tests that failed in the last test
execution. Sometimes Tempest tests fail due to a special temporary
condition in the environment, in such cases it is very useful to be able
to re-execute those tests.

Running the following command will re-run all the test that failed
during the last test execution regardless of what test suite was run.
$ rally verify start --failing

Change-Id: Ieccb6d2a28175c3445d028e81ae2718e4fce375b
Implements: blueprint re-run-failed-tempest-tests
'}]
commit_message:
Re-run failed Tempest tests

Add the ability to re-run the tempest tests that failed in the last test
execution. Sometimes Tempest tests fail due to a special temporary
condition in the environment, in such cases it is very useful to be able
to re-execute those tests.

Running the following command will re-run all the test that failed
during the last test execution regardless of what test suite was run.
$ rally verify start --failing

Change-Id: Ieccb6d2a28175c3445d028e81ae2718e4fce375b
Implements: blueprint re-run-failed-tempest-tests

commit_message:
Added default sort in collection serializer

Default order is an ascending order by model's primary key
In the most cases, now it is ascending sort by 'id' field.

Change-Id: Ic83e7cc2bb5eb9ef8d90bb0dacc54eda50736c75
Closes-Bug: #1536392

commit_message:
Use assert(Not)Equal/Less/GreaterEqual

Instead of using assertFalse(A * B) / assertTrue(A * B),
developers should use assertEqual/NotEqual/Less/GreaterEqual
The * operator: '==', '!=', '<', '>='

Change-Id: I18b60ef46ff918f9a97eb00eacf3582964580c62

commit_message:
Restore the authorized_keys file in 'cobbler' container

SSH restore must go before Cobbler restore to ensure
that /etc/cobbler/authorized_keys file is updated
with appropriate public key.

Change-Id: Ie9493e883885cfc167920bfe35d5545d05c378e9
Closes-bug: 1551339

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-03-02 13:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_deploy.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/orchestrator.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/urls.py'], 'message': 'Add handler for serialized tasks used in t-b deployment

Handler will return output of the same serialized graph used for
deployment in json format. And it will be available using next uri

GET clusters/<:cluster_id>/serialized_tasks?nodes=1,2,3&tasks=task1,task2

Expected return codes are the following:

200 - serialized tasks returned
400 - task based deployment is not enabled for cluster
400 - Nodes dont belong to same cluster
404 - cluster or nodes - not found

implements blueprint serialized-graph

Change-Id: I170011778296acdb977f9d938c062f14c1c3d556
'}]
commit_message:
Add handler for serialized tasks used in t-b deployment

Handler will return output of the same serialized graph used for
deployment in json format. And it will be available using next uri

GET clusters/<:cluster_id>/serialized_tasks?nodes=1,2,3&tasks=task1,task2

Expected return codes are the following:

200 - serialized tasks returned
400 - task based deployment is not enabled for cluster
400 - Nodes dont belong to same cluster
404 - cluster or nodes - not found

implements blueprint serialized-graph

Change-Id: I170011778296acdb977f9d938c062f14c1c3d556

commit_message:
Pass username/password to SwiftService

Similar to the change we made for swift Connection in os-client-config,
pass any username/password info we have into the swift SwiftService
object so that if it needs to re-auth it has the information.

Change-Id: Ie850b8831d0192420289960b210b7a520c8c3322

commit_message:
[Murano Docs]/[docs] Replace all instances of "tenant" with "project"

There are multiple places throughout Murano docs that still
use the term "tenant". In order to help transition to v3
keystone API, these instances should be replaced with the word
"project".

All of the docs have been updated accordingly. I reference "tenant"
in parenthesis in a few appropriate places as a way to help with
any confusion during the transition.

Change-Id: I41de7c272198c471ae60fa47f3554085308dae68
Closes-Bug: #1514756

subject: Update get_vm_power_state_listener to retrieve a poller
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-02 12:06:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py'], 'message': "Update get_vm_power_state_listener to retrieve a poller

At the moment, the event polling is done by the caller, using the
listener we return here. This means that Hyper-V generated events
will 'leak' out of the library.

This patch adds an optional argument so that the caller can request
a handler instead, so it does not have to handle hyper-v specific
objects and WMI exceptions, which in fact should be done by os-win.
This event handler will invoke a callback with the VM name and power
state, as that's all the caller will care about.

Change-Id: Iddc52878bcc84bf3d8c31edbcd178eac4b59092d
"}]
commit_message:
Update get_vm_power_state_listener to retrieve a poller

At the moment, the event polling is done by the caller, using the
listener we return here. This means that Hyper-V generated events
will 'leak' out of the library.

This patch adds an optional argument so that the caller can request
a handler instead, so it does not have to handle hyper-v specific
objects and WMI exceptions, which in fact should be done by os-win.
This event handler will invoke a callback with the VM name and power
state, as that's all the caller will care about.

Change-Id: Iddc52878bcc84bf3d8c31edbcd178eac4b59092d

subject: add wipefs to ironic-lib.filters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 18:08:16.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/rootwrap.d/ironic-lib.filters'], 'message': "add wipefs to ironic-lib.filters

I39637e22c344703ad48fc271f6f866aa018bbdd1 introduces the use of wipefs
to clean a disk, this through the ironic_lib.disk_utils module. wipefs
has been added to ironic_lib's rootwrap filter filter as expected.

We need to keep this one in sync because:
- of the gate: devstack uses it instead of the one from ironic_lib
- to preserve exsisting deployed installation where ironic_lib's filter
  is not properly deployed yet.

This commit also comes with a NOTE message to explain the situation.

Change-Id: Id69706d7a78ff37a360cc23d6a076bc13bbdf14c
"}]
commit_message:
add wipefs to ironic-lib.filters

I39637e22c344703ad48fc271f6f866aa018bbdd1 introduces the use of wipefs
to clean a disk, this through the ironic_lib.disk_utils module. wipefs
has been added to ironic_lib's rootwrap filter filter as expected.

We need to keep this one in sync because:
- of the gate: devstack uses it instead of the one from ironic_lib
- to preserve exsisting deployed installation where ironic_lib's filter
  is not properly deployed yet.

This commit also comes with a NOTE message to explain the situation.

Change-Id: Id69706d7a78ff37a360cc23d6a076bc13bbdf14c

subject: Allow container template to recognize an update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-25 18:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['docker/compute-post.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow container template to recognize an update

The deployment resource looks for a change in name when
running an update.  If there is no change in containers,
docker will recognize that and the deployment will return.
If there is a new available container, docker will swap out
the old running container for a new one.

Change-Id: I60d45b5ef45714e6e0140dfc80c14d6a12701f32
(cherry picked from commit 2928886f88a7ad1a876ec7e0bd59c746d49f006c)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow container template to recognize an update

The deployment resource looks for a change in name when
running an update.  If there is no change in containers,
docker will recognize that and the deployment will return.
If there is a new available container, docker will swap out
the old running container for a new one.

Change-Id: I60d45b5ef45714e6e0140dfc80c14d6a12701f32
(cherry picked from commit 2928886f88a7ad1a876ec7e0bd59c746d49f006c)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-19 15:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/resources/bios.py'], 'message': 'Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ide5daf929e2e1717f6a756d609071ff329f443a8
Closes-Bug: #1508442
'}]
commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ide5daf929e2e1717f6a756d609071ff329f443a8
Closes-Bug: #1508442

commit_message:
Suppress curl progress indicator in rabbit OCF

Upstream PR: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/597

curl is used by OCF script for fetching definitions (queues etc.), but
results of that invocation is shown as garbage in pacemaker logs -
progress indicator doesn't make any sense in logs.

According to curl manpage the following combination of options should be
used "--silent --show-error" - this will suppress only progress
indicator, errors will still be shown.

Also other short curl options are replaced with their long counterparts
- for improved readability.

Change-Id: I5ae35b3f76dc33be68c79f5dc983f0c779529fb9
Closes-Bug: #1540831

Keystone API v2 is deprecated, so murano must use v3 API by default.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-27 07:16:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py', 'cinder/quota_utils.py', 'cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_quota_utils.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/066_add_allocated_id_column_to_reservations.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_quota.py', 'cinder/quota.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_migrations.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Re-enable -1 child limits for nested quotas

Add back support for -1 limits of child projects. The way that we
support the -1 child limits requires the following changes:
  * Continue quota validation up the hierarchy if the current limit is
    -1 until we hit a hard limit or no more parents, and update the
    any relevant parents' allocated value along the way
  * When updating limits, special care needs to be taken when updating
    child limit to be -1, or when changing from a -1 limit
  * Enable support for creating reservations for "allocated" values
    to support the scenario that:
      - a volume is created on a project with a limit of -1
      - the parent's allocated value has been updated appropriately
      - the volume create fails and the child's in_use quota rolls back
      - now we must also rollback the parent's allocated value

NOTE: There is a race condition between validation the NestedQuotas
and when the driver may be switched into use, and if -1 quotas are used
the validation could be out of date. Will look into better support for
switching on of NestedQuotas on live deployment with -1 limits, which
would likely leverage the "allocated" reservation system.

Closes-Bug: #1548645
Closes-Bug: #1544774
Closes-Bug: #1537189
Change-Id: I2d1dba87baf3595cc8f48574e0281ac17509fe7d
'}]
commit_message:
Re-enable -1 child limits for nested quotas

Add back support for -1 limits of child projects. The way that we
support the -1 child limits requires the following changes:
  * Continue quota validation up the hierarchy if the current limit is
    -1 until we hit a hard limit or no more parents, and update the
    any relevant parents' allocated value along the way
  * When updating limits, special care needs to be taken when updating
    child limit to be -1, or when changing from a -1 limit
  * Enable support for creating reservations for "allocated" values
    to support the scenario that:
      - a volume is created on a project with a limit of -1
      - the parent's allocated value has been updated appropriately
      - the volume create fails and the child's in_use quota rolls back
      - now we must also rollback the parent's allocated value

NOTE: There is a race condition between validation the NestedQuotas
and when the driver may be switched into use, and if -1 quotas are used
the validation could be out of date. Will look into better support for
switching on of NestedQuotas on live deployment with -1 limits, which
would likely leverage the "allocated" reservation system.

Closes-Bug: #1548645
Closes-Bug: #1544774
Closes-Bug: #1537189
Change-Id: I2d1dba87baf3595cc8f48574e0281ac17509fe7d

Fix controller floating network idempotency

This change fixes the variable to use for the floating pool name when we
call nova::api and updates the noop tests to check the nova::api class
parameters.

Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-27 03:46:16.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/config.py', 'bandit/core/test_set.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_config.py', 'bandit/cli/main.py'], 'message': "Adding support for new style profile

This commit adds support for the new style of Bandit profile.
These are typically generated by the Bandit Config Generator tool
and may be used to select or exclude tests or override the
settings for plugins.

Since we still need support for legacy config/profiles and it
doesn't make sense to add a new flag this overloads the profile
setting.  It will first detect if the profile is a file or a
legacy profile.  This is written with the idea that it will be
easy to find and get rid of legacy code when we're ready.

Change-Id: I939639be795249eee9d3598b4e9f190e64efe405
"}]
commit_message:
Adding support for new style profile

This commit adds support for the new style of Bandit profile.
These are typically generated by the Bandit Config Generator tool
and may be used to select or exclude tests or override the
settings for plugins.

Since we still need support for legacy config/profiles and it
doesn't make sense to add a new flag this overloads the profile
setting.  It will first detect if the profile is a file or a
legacy profile.  This is written with the idea that it will be
easy to find and get rid of legacy code when we're ready.

Change-Id: I939639be795249eee9d3598b4e9f190e64efe405

commit_message:
Clean up create load balancer workflow

There were a few problems identified with the create load balancer
workflow and this patch corrects them. It sets a default port when
selecting a listener protocol, updates the allowed health monitor
status codes, removes the pool member description since an
instance does not have a description, removes the HTTPS options for
listener and health monitor protocols, and removes the pool protocol
selection since this can be determined by the listener protocol.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: Ica296495b02689bc8616a52dfd709dc323e9bf45

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-02 11:11:43.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh'], 'message': "Upgrades: install zaqarclient

Old overcloud images don't have python-zaqarclient installed, and new
overclouds' os-collect-config are configured with Zaqar support. This
together means that on upgrade we need to install python-zaqarclient,
otherwise os-collect-config will be restarted during yum update and

Change-Id: I3e875e14cb60b1b78aec0d9ddc412ccf865abd01
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: install zaqarclient

Old overcloud images don't have python-zaqarclient installed, and new
overclouds' os-collect-config are configured with Zaqar support. This
together means that on upgrade we need to install python-zaqarclient,
otherwise os-collect-config will be restarted during yum update and
crash due to trying to import missing Python module from zaqarclient.

Change-Id: I3e875e14cb60b1b78aec0d9ddc412ccf865abd01

commit_message:
Add Credential Authentication Usage Documentation

This patch adds documentation on using the new credential
object. It is the last of several patches which will implement the
"Allow different Keystone Auth Support in Castellan" blueprint.

Change-Id: I22608e83f46b4cc77ad6a5e41a95389751b0ecbf
Implements: blueprint remove-keystone-dependency

commit_message:
Ignore TypeErrors on old properties during update

Extend the approach from 1cfde62b2ff8a60c8cc3a9ef4926e5f4a7116aee of
ignoring ValueErrors in the _previous_ properties when doing an update to
also ignoring TypeErrors.

Change-Id: Ic08165fe031e1764cfb34eaf782d3e105f04fee3
Closes-Bug: #1538551
Related-Bug: #1543685
(cherry picked from commit 79c410d92326e63c8bf3752922c35abf6264e211)

commit_message:
Allow Barbican Key Manager to accept different auth credentials

This patch alters the barbican key manager to be able to use
Token, Password, and OSLO Credentials. It is the third of
several patches which will implement the
"Allow different Keystone Auth Support in Castellan" blueprint.

Other patches will add:
1.) documentation on usage

Needs Functional Tests
Change-Id: Ib3bb9d4e167f0b85bcf7a9053743239c9e6e6dae
Implements: blueprint remove-keystone-dependency

commit_message:
Upgrades: quiet yum update

Quiet down yum during major upgrades to reduce the output size. This is
consistent with what was introduced into minor updates in change
I517271e8465885421a78b73c5af756816c37a977.

Ceilometer Alarm is deprecated in Liberty by Aodh.

This patch:
* deploy Apache (Aodh runs in WSGI)
* manage Aodh Keystone resources
* deploy Aodh API under WSGI, Notifier, Listener and Evaluator
* manage new parameters to customize Aodh deployment

Change-Id: I8ae85083b18e12d5bfedb63bfbd5f1c0eae2d2a6
Depends-On: Ied8ba5985f43a5c5b3be5b35a091aef6ed86572f

commit_message:
Deploy Aodh services, replacing Ceilometer Alarm

Ceilometer Alarm is deprecated in Liberty by Aodh.

This patch:
* deploy Apache (Aodh runs in WSGI)
* manage Aodh Keystone resources
* deploy Aodh API under WSGI, Notifier, Listener and Evaluator
* manage new parameters to customize Aodh deployment

Change-Id: I8ae85083b18e12d5bfedb63bfbd5f1c0eae2d2a6
Depends-On: Ied8ba5985f43a5c5b3be5b35a091aef6ed86572f
(cherry picked from commit 3102263862c402ef5d57b82a462685cb27d45f97)

commit_message:
Scheduler enhancements for Share Replication

Backends supporting replication of shares could be
limited by vendor or storage model or software. Cloud
administrators may also need to configure backends
outside of Manila to support replication between these
backends.

Hence, Manila should allow administrators to specify
'replication_domain's. This configuration is reported to the
scheduler as a backend capability as part of the
_update_share_stats() driver call. The scheduler
should acknowledge this 'capability' when scheduling
shares supporting replication and replicas themselves.

Introduce a new scheduler filter that uses a backend
reported "capability" called 'replication_domain'.

Implements bp: manila-dr-scheduler-enhancements

DocImpact

Change-Id: I194054a9a1071c2d577a588e3299ae81490cd0f8

commit_message:
HyperV: Set disk serial number for attached volumes

Setting the disk serial number allows us to easily map volumes
with the according virtual disk resources.

This is required for the Fibre Channel support implementation, as
well for the patch fixing the swapped VM disks after host reboot.

Co-Authored-By: Alin Balutoiu <abalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

(cherry picked from commit 82bf282dd599d9c1528a34a032513e6721ae9876)

commit_message:
Use isinstance() for result type checking

Shade has been broken in the past by the underlying clients deciding
to change their API and return a subclass of the thing they used to
return. For this reason, let's use isinstance() instead of type().

Change-Id: I1e50d5314fb2cd7d7f8fcf77a3714704ca738672

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 22:09:03.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Hack around version conflict installing fixtures/testtools

Based on the g-r caps for kilo, we install fixtures 1.2.0
which requires uncapped testtools which pulls in testtools
2.0.0 which requires fixtures>=1.3.0 which breaks against the
cap in g-r for fixtures (which is <1.3.0).

Normally we'd move testtools before fixtures in test-requirements
and that would resolve things, but on kilo we install
oslo.concurrency 1.8.2 from requirements.txt (before test-reqs)
and oslo.concurrency depends on fixtures in it's requirements,
so we don't even get to install our capped testtools first.

To hack around this, install testtools in tox.ini first before
processing any requirements.

This should be reverted once fixtures 1.2.1 is released with a
cap on testtools<2.0.0.

Change-Id: Iaa2a7aa3d57deeced4003cff268b46cc427d12cf
Related-Bug: #1542984
"}]
commit_message:
Hack around version conflict installing fixtures/testtools

Based on the g-r caps for kilo, we install fixtures 1.2.0
which requires uncapped testtools which pulls in testtools
2.0.0 which requires fixtures>=1.3.0 which breaks against the
cap in g-r for fixtures (which is <1.3.0).

Normally we'd move testtools before fixtures in test-requirements
and that would resolve things, but on kilo we install
oslo.concurrency 1.8.2 from requirements.txt (before test-reqs)
and oslo.concurrency depends on fixtures in it's requirements,
so we don't even get to install our capped testtools first.

To hack around this, install testtools in tox.ini first before
processing any requirements.

This should be reverted once fixtures 1.2.1 is released with a
cap on testtools<2.0.0.

Change-Id: Iaa2a7aa3d57deeced4003cff268b46cc427d12cf
Related-Bug: #1542984

commit_message:
Floating IP support design (ready for review).

This patch contains the design for Floating IP support for OVN. The
design proposal contains the changes required in the networking-ovn
plugin and the changes required in OVN. The OVN changes will be
discussed in the ovs-dev mailing list and changes will be reflected
in this design proposal.

Change-Id: I25d758c9ade444e95e454c5f456ad7bef0cfaaec
Related-Bug: 1514995
Co-Authored-By: Chandra Sekhar Vejendla <csvejend@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Implement E501 flake8 check with longer line limit

The max-line-length is being set at a greater width in order to accommodate
jinja templating in python files, especially in the shebang.

It is better to have a longer line length limit than to ignore the check
entirely.

Change-Id: I6daa58ff18a29cc378b9cab8d240f397be9aff8b

subject: Switch tempest to use the public network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 23:28:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Switch tempest to use the public network

Tempest isn't guaranteed to have access to a private network. It
depends on the underlying network topology of the cloud and in many
cases the private network isn't externally accesible. Granted these
are just labels, but the implication of the name is we should be
using the public network, not the private.

Change-Id: I377479418b72464504863304a3a13f2721b4749d
"}]
commit_message:
Switch tempest to use the public network

Tempest isn't guaranteed to have access to a private network. It
depends on the underlying network topology of the cloud and in many
cases the private network isn't externally accesible. Granted these
are just labels, but the implication of the name is we should be
using the public network, not the private.

Change-Id: I377479418b72464504863304a3a13f2721b4749d

commit_message:
Support "network create" command in nova network

This patch only provide network name and subnet setting for
"network create" command.

The other options, such as --project which depends on
identity v2 or v3, will make the unit tests too complicated.
So I prefer to implement them in other patches.

Change-Id: I9ec93f0af813c8fae4170c36e16bbe8f0f53cbb6
Partial-Bug: 1543672

subject: Add overcloud-base element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 12:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['elements/overcloud-base/README.md', 'elements/overcloud-compute/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-contrail-controller/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-cinder-volume/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/install.d/package-installs-overcloud-base', 'elements/overcloud-controller/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/pkg-map', 'elements/overcloud-ceph-storage/element-deps'], 'message': 'Add overcloud-base element

This patch adds a new overcloud-base element that currently
installs the python-ipaddr package. Per t-h-t commit 45be848
python-ipaddr is now required for network validations on
all nodes.

Change-Id: Ia617f44b4673b89202e5e5cdcac9b50f46b3e6c8
Closes-bug: #1551048
(cherry picked from commit b217175340dfb10bdbaf158c00ba2535afd4bde9)

commit_message:
Add overcloud-base element

This patch adds a new overcloud-base element that currently
installs the python-ipaddr package. Per t-h-t commit 45be848
python-ipaddr is now required for network validations on
all nodes.

Change-Id: Ia617f44b4673b89202e5e5cdcac9b50f46b3e6c8
Closes-bug: #1551048
(cherry picked from commit b217175340dfb10bdbaf158c00ba2535afd4bde9)

subject: Also reset swift service object at upload time
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-02 04:56:03.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Also reset swift service object at upload time

When you follow through swiftclient.service.SwiftService() it ends up
creating a swift swiftclient.connection.Connection() object within it
[1].

As noted in change Ib35dd49627bc2209060848e719e3cec40dbb4f2a ; the
swift client object does not support keystone sessions, so does not
handle having an expired token (tokens for RAX, the cloud we see this
issue with in nodepool, expire after 24 hours).

This leads to a very confusing exception about "No tenant specified"
[2] which I believe is actually somewhat of a red-herring; what has
happened is that the authentication failed, the client inside the
SwiftService object doing the upload hits its retry path and we end an
authentication failure path [3] that outputs this message.

The split between what happens in a swiftclient Connection() object
versus a SwiftService() object further suggests this is the failure
point -- you use the client object to do things list
list/create/delete containers, but the SwiftService object provides
the wrappers that handle the actual upload of the objects.  This
explains why we see the exception raised in the upload image path, but
not the creation of the containers to hold the image.

As with the swift client issue, the simplest way around this is to
always request a new SwiftService object when uploading a new image.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-swiftclient/tree/swiftclient/service.py#n226
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/488685/
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-swiftclient/tree/swiftclient/client.py#n1544

Change-Id: I1c9d71ec828eb7d67045fb6bef468dc20e67292b
'}]
commit_message:
Also reset swift service object at upload time

When you follow through swiftclient.service.SwiftService() it ends up
creating a swift swiftclient.connection.Connection() object within it
[1].

As noted in change Ib35dd49627bc2209060848e719e3cec40dbb4f2a ; the
swift client object does not support keystone sessions, so does not
handle having an expired token (tokens for RAX, the cloud we see this
issue with in nodepool, expire after 24 hours).

This leads to a very confusing exception about "No tenant specified"
[2] which I believe is actually somewhat of a red-herring; what has
happened is that the authentication failed, the client inside the
SwiftService object doing the upload hits its retry path and we end an
authentication failure path [3] that outputs this message.

The split between what happens in a swiftclient Connection() object
versus a SwiftService() object further suggests this is the failure
point -- you use the client object to do things list
list/create/delete containers, but the SwiftService object provides
the wrappers that handle the actual upload of the objects.  This
explains why we see the exception raised in the upload image path, but
not the creation of the containers to hold the image.

As with the swift client issue, the simplest way around this is to
always request a new SwiftService object when uploading a new image.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-swiftclient/tree/swiftclient/service.py#n226
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/488685/
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-swiftclient/tree/swiftclient/client.py#n1544

Change-Id: I1c9d71ec828eb7d67045fb6bef468dc20e67292b

swift backend: don't put / in the default auth url

Don't put the trailing slash at the end of the default auth url or
Glance will fail to upload images in Swift.

commit_message:
Move policy_specified handling to PolicyCollection

This squeeze policy_specified handling on test_container
to FunctionalStoragePolicyCollection to be more intuitive.

In addition, we should raise AssertionError if the policy_specified
is set but not found in the FunctionalStoragePolicyCollection to
prevent to test for not a desirable policy.

Change-Id: I67ef1dd1f94ec0382a9b10f0bdada08e71463b00

revisions:

'}]
commit_message:
Invalidate volume cache when waiting for attach

We need to invalidate the volume cache when waiting for volume attach to
complete otherwise we never see the attachment complete (the cached data
is perpetually stale).

Change-Id: If875997b7fb6682ef4752852c58ea1b4cf52de91

In the Projects table under Identity, the description field for the
default projects have '-' value to represent a blank description.
When we create a new project and leave the description empty, it
shows up as an empty field in the table. This patch fixes this
inconsistency by showing an empty description field which is
consistent with the description fields in Instances and Volumes
table.

Change-Id: Ie8b5b1f852856ca3337d69fa3a2e30f81b1ffb07
Closes-Bug: #1370935
"}]
commit_message:
Make empty description field value consistent

In the Projects table under Identity, the description field for the
default projects have '-' value to represent a blank description.
When we create a new project and leave the description empty, it
shows up as an empty field in the table. This patch fixes this
inconsistency by showing an empty description field which is
consistent with the description fields in Instances and Volumes
table.

Change-Id: Ie8b5b1f852856ca3337d69fa3a2e30f81b1ffb07
Closes-Bug: #1370935

subject: Ensure the zone records quota is enforced
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-01 15:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py', 'designate/central/service.py', 'designate/tests/test_central/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Ensure the zone records quota is enforced

When creating a recordset, we only assert the recordset specific quota
is respected, ignoring the zone record quota.

This updates the code to enforce the records quota as well as excludes
the managed records when calculating the quota. Also, the submitted
records are taken into account when testing the quota. For example, if
the total number is 10 and the limit is 11 (the total must be less
than the quota), submitting an update to a recordset to lower the
number of A records from 5 to 3 should be allowed.

Closes-Bug: #1548331
Change-Id: I26839eca1c4901c5b8dbe3db69044c4da889b7d8
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the zone records quota is enforced

When creating a recordset, we only assert the recordset specific quota
is respected, ignoring the zone record quota.

This updates the code to enforce the records quota as well as excludes
the managed records when calculating the quota. Also, the submitted
records are taken into account when testing the quota. For example, if
the total number is 10 and the limit is 11 (the total must be less
than the quota), submitting an update to a recordset to lower the
number of A records from 5 to 3 should be allowed.

Closes-Bug: #1548331
Change-Id: I26839eca1c4901c5b8dbe3db69044c4da889b7d8

commit_message:
Disable HA for RPC queues by default

RPC wihout HA was tested on a big scale and we found that it greatly
reduces load OpenStack puts on RabbitMQ. Hence it is valuable to
disable it by default.

DocImpact

It should be noted in the release notes that starting from 8.0 queue
mirroring is disabled by default for RPC queues, but it is still
enabled for Ceilometer ones.

Also, the change should be reflected in our reference architecture
guide. Specifically, there is a sentence here starting with
"RabbitMQ provides active/active high availability ...", which will
be incorrect after the given change is merged.

Users are still provided with means to enable mirroring. Details
could be found in description of that commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249180/

Closes-Bug: #1550303
Change-Id: Iffa4173c2e6bb54e411defc7bdc44254669be5fd

subject: [inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 14:14:22.000000000', 'files': ['templates/inspector_dnsmasq_tftp.erb', 'templates/inspector_dnsmasq_http.erb'], 'message': "[inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf

Introspection naturally happens in large bulks, after which it's inactive.
Small pool for DHCP addresses means that we'll have conflicts due to how
dnsmasq distributes them by default - using hashing. This change tells dnsmasq
to allocate IP addresses sequentially instead to avoid these conflicts.

The drawback of this option is that long-running clients may switch IP
addresses if their lease expires. This is not a concern for short introspection
process.

Change-Id: I0f08609a9f72799ef9f62216041f2b2b9795afd5
"}]
commit_message:
[inspector] use dnsmasq dhcp-sequential-ip flag in dnsmasq.conf

Introspection naturally happens in large bulks, after which it's inactive.
Small pool for DHCP addresses means that we'll have conflicts due to how
dnsmasq distributes them by default - using hashing. This change tells dnsmasq
to allocate IP addresses sequentially instead to avoid these conflicts.

The drawback of this option is that long-running clients may switch IP
addresses if their lease expires. This is not a concern for short introspection
process.

Change-Id: I0f08609a9f72799ef9f62216041f2b2b9795afd5

commit_message:
Fix requirements and tests for python-fuelclient 8.0

* bump pbr version to >=1.6 as it is in global-requirements
* uncomment extras section in setup.cfg as new pbr can handle it now
* turn off "newly" introduced fuzzy command suggestions in cliff for
  tests

Change-Id: I161813b7e25719b6bb19909adfc2d094c5c480ce

commit_message:
Create non-root user account during image build process

Extended Nailgun data driver to parse new ks_meta keys.

Extended Ubuntu cloud-init config template to create a non-root
account. Root login is being disabled, however, this setting
will only be effective until osnailyfacter::ssh puppet class
will have been evaluated during deployment as it overrides
sshd_config values. This means, that PermitRootLogin should be
managed by library as well.

Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes
Depends-On: Ia18305e07d07377886783c3b3e44abe93cef2da5

Change-Id: I69831fe0327ef9ac55bed99301d2c3732b87ed88

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-16 18:01:57.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_watch.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Create watch tasks in its own thread

This change moves the creation of stack watch tasks into its own thread
which retries until it has been done without error.

The intent is to prevent create_periodic_tasks from raising an error
when the database is not available, and retry stack watch creation until
the database becomes available.

Once execution gets past create_periodic_tasks() then systemd is
notified that the service is up, and heat will recover when the database
comes back.

Change-Id: I4d61022db505581f0c1b2feed009c56df18a9ee5
Closes-Bug: #1545885
'}]
commit_message:
Create watch tasks in its own thread

This change moves the creation of stack watch tasks into its own thread
which retries until it has been done without error.

The intent is to prevent create_periodic_tasks from raising an error
when the database is not available, and retry stack watch creation until
the database becomes available.

Once execution gets past create_periodic_tasks() then systemd is
notified that the service is up, and heat will recover when the database
comes back.

Change-Id: I4d61022db505581f0c1b2feed009c56df18a9ee5
Closes-Bug: #1545885

subject: Add ability to pass just filename to create_image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-21 23:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Add ability to pass just filename to create_image

There is a common use case of wanting to create a disk image and then
upload it to the cloud where the name of the diskimage minus the file
extension is the desired name of the image in the cloud. Support that
easily by checking to see if the user passed in a filename as the first
paramater and, if so, use it as the filename and strip the path and
extension to use as the name.

Also, document the method while we're in there.

Change-Id: Iade5f071544775864534660b544a6a01b15a2adb
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to pass just filename to create_image

There is a common use case of wanting to create a disk image and then
upload it to the cloud where the name of the diskimage minus the file
extension is the desired name of the image in the cloud. Support that
easily by checking to see if the user passed in a filename as the first
paramater and, if so, use it as the filename and strip the path and
extension to use as the name.

Also, document the method while we're in there.

Change-Id: Iade5f071544775864534660b544a6a01b15a2adb

commit_message:
Add --force flag for `fuel deploy-changes` command

The flag allows to apply the changes to the cluster if the cluster
is in the operational state. This allows you to deploy the changes
without the reprovisioning procedure.

Example: `fuel deploy-changes --env <env_id> --force`

Partial-Bug: 1540558
Change-Id: Ibc89fdbfbd0a36a890412cd8e861d35bcf930690

subject: swift: Do not search storage_url for ks v2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 09:07:44.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/connection_manager.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "swift: Do not search storage_url for ks v2

Previously, we introduced a re-auth approach for swift store.
In case of single-tenant store we stated that it works with
Keystone v3 only when re-authenticating but we also need to make
the same restriction when receiving swift endpoint from keystone
becase it breaks some installations where auth_url contains
trailing slash.

So now if auth_version is not v3 then we don't search endpoint url
from Keystone in this case and simply return None. It is safe
because we don't do any re-authentication for v1 or v2 and use
old methods for that version.

Change-Id: Id8dab9ed74eef56ffa4937bf29f96888b673ad64
Closes-Bug: #1552132
"}]
commit_message:
swift: Do not search storage_url for ks v2

Previously, we introduced a re-auth approach for swift store.
In case of single-tenant store we stated that it works with
Keystone v3 only when re-authenticating but we also need to make
the same restriction when receiving swift endpoint from keystone
becase it breaks some installations where auth_url contains
trailing slash.

So now if auth_version is not v3 then we don't search endpoint url
from Keystone in this case and simply return None. It is safe
because we don't do any re-authentication for v1 or v2 and use
old methods for that version.

Change-Id: Id8dab9ed74eef56ffa4937bf29f96888b673ad64
Closes-Bug: #1552132

commit_message:
Fixes the templated backend tests for Python3

Dictionaries are no longer sortable in Python3. To get around this we
provide a customer key to sorted and just sort by the 'id' value.

bp python3

Change-Id: Ie648b457fd92cde140d9fa2efb5127f0f26c243a

commit_message:
Fix parameter constraint formatting

The constraints generated by the resource-type-template command are
improperly formatted for parameters, resulting in an invalid template
being created. This fixes the parameter generation code to make sure
the constraints are properly formatted.

Change-Id: Ifa0d63d30ff0a3b3fea5476e10982585b42597d6
Closes-Bug: #1545832

commit_message:
Disable VIP allocation on PUT for network configuration handlers

Now method does not trigger allocation of VIPs and returns serialized
data in format as GET does, that is without real IP address if a VIP
was not allocated previously. Tests updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I9f291be8912baedaf5814a8cb3181f38a8dac1bf
Blueprint: allow-any-vip

commit_message:
Update tempest plugin after tempest-lib deprecation

Latest tempest code doesn't using tempest-lib anymore. Tempest-lib
project now marked for deprecation. Tempest-lib code now lives in
tempest repository and to avoid any Import errors connected with
tempest-lib we should update our tempest tests.

- This patch replaces all insertions of tempest_lib to tempest.lib

Change-Id: Ifed108f3b56cc35cc7c5e53f7a0d128e3d4643f8
Closes-Bug: #1551863

subject: Provide user with coherent interface to get request_ids
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 16066, 'name': 'xiexs', 'email': 'xiexs@cn.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'simen'}, {'_account_id': 20105, 'name': 'Cao ShuFeng', 'email': 'caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'caosf.fnst'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-15 09:51:42.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_hosts.py', 'novaclient/v2/servers.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_servers.py', 'novaclient/v2/hosts.py'], 'message': "Provide user with coherent interface to get request_ids

Currently, users must use different interface to get request_ids.
1. Commonly, ListWithMeta, DictWithMeta or TupleWithMeta, etc is
returned to user. And request_ids is returned as an attribute of
*WithMeta.

    For a server delete action:
        result = serverManager.delete(server)
        # result = TupelWithMeta
        request_ids = result.request_ids

2. Some places reutrn a tuple which contains request_ids in one of
its elements.

    For a server stop action:
        result = serverManager.stop(server)
        # result = (Response, TupleWithMeta)
        request_ids = result[1].request_ids

Such kind of difference makes user confused.
This change provides a backwards compatibility solution for users
who don't care about request_ids as TupleWithMeta is subclass of
tuple.

Change-Id: I164bb95abce6dc96cf455033f02822ccb0d87b8f
Closes-Bug: 1542179
"}]
commit_message:
Provide user with coherent interface to get request_ids

Currently, users must use different interface to get request_ids.
1. Commonly, ListWithMeta, DictWithMeta or TupleWithMeta, etc is
returned to user. And request_ids is returned as an attribute of
*WithMeta.

    For a server delete action:
        result = serverManager.delete(server)
        # result = TupelWithMeta
        request_ids = result.request_ids

2. Some places reutrn a tuple which contains request_ids in one of
its elements.

    For a server stop action:
        result = serverManager.stop(server)
        # result = (Response, TupleWithMeta)
        request_ids = result[1].request_ids

Such kind of difference makes user confused.
This change provides a backwards compatibility solution for users
who don't care about request_ids as TupleWithMeta is subclass of
tuple.

Change-Id: I164bb95abce6dc96cf455033f02822ccb0d87b8f
Closes-Bug: 1542179

commit_message:
Ability to have several MuranoPL classes in single YAML file

Classes are separated using YAML document separator (3 dashes).
Empty documents are skipped. If the class doesn't have Namespace
section corresponding section from the previous class in the same
file is used. Thus it is possible to declare namespace prefixes once
at the file header. Even if there are several classes in one file all of
them are still required to be declared in manifest file (except for
the DSL unit tests that don't have manifests)

Change-Id: Ic8df487d8a7c327f085f9723c251e99fa998c481

commit_message:
Close all ssh connection on revert_snapshot instead of re-using

This patch introduces workaround which closes all
ssh connection instead of re-using them.
We need it in order not to stuck for 15 minutes each time after
resuming snapshot. So we decrease system test time on n*15,
where n - number of revert_snapshot operations and in the
most cases this value is 3. So we save 3*15 = 45 min for each
test

Related-bug: #1549274

Change-Id: I3b2f1a2058bbc736578ac3c30a92e938009ed597

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-21 14:37:33.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': 'Fix deleting containers behavior when half of container servers downed

A request for deleting container comes when container servers downed.
The request is handled by hand-off container servers but there is no
db in the servers so the request gets 404.

If number of replicas is even number (more than three) and half of
container servers downed, new requests for deleting container are NOT

'}]
commit_message:
Fix deleting containers behavior when half of container servers downed

A request for deleting container comes when container servers downed.
The request is handled by hand-off container servers but there is no
db in the servers so the request gets 404.

If number of replicas is even number (more than three) and half of
container servers downed, new requests for deleting container are NOT
success. The internal statuses are 204 and 404 so the response code
will be 503.

This patch overrides 404 status in the case 204 so new requests for
deleting container will be succeeded.

Swift recommends number of replicas is odd number but some deployers
use even number because of combination with SDS products.

Change-Id: Ibb217f752ddaf64602a73911a139f78090a9d1cc

commit_message:
Fix posting containers behavior when half of container servers downed

Container servers downed when a request for posting container comes.
The request is handled with a hand-off container server but there is
no targeted container in the server (because it's a hand-off) so the
hand-off container server responded 404.

If number of replicas is even number (more than three) and half of
container servers downed, new requests for posting container NOT
success (but container meta will be replicated). The internal statuses
are 204 and 404 so the response code will be 503.

This patch overrides 404 status in the case with 204 so new requests
for posting container will be succeeded.

Swift recommends number of replicas is odd number but some deployers
use even number because of combination with SDS products.

Change-Id: Idbe16e690bb95b42c14f6d19d8f8086b39374db8
