commit_message:
Fix posting accounts behavior when half of account servers downed

Account servers downed when a request for posting account comes. The
request is handled by hand-off account servers but there is no
targeted account in the servers (because it's a hand-off) so the
hand-off account servers responded 404.

If number of replicas is even number (more than three) and half of
account servers downed, new requests for posting account are NOT
success (but account meta will be replicated). The internal statuses
are 204 and 404 so the response code will be 503.

This patch overrides 404 status in the case 204 so new requests for
posting account will be succeeded.

Swift recommends number of replicas is odd number but some deployers
use even number because of combination with SDS products.

Change-Id: Ic45ec60c7abe19051ae18c0889f352b75668cd0f

commit_message:
Nova RPC unpinning

During upgrades, we only run Puppet on the whole deployment to converge
the state, after the upgrade workflow itself has been fully
completed. That is an opportunity to utilize Puppet to make sure Nova
Compute RPC doesn't remain pinned to the older version.

Change-Id: I6ebc813a80dfd9dfbbb213c38724487e044507b8
(cherry picked from commit 02b3025585db9134ea2c01e4a644c602a1c48862)

commit_message:
Bind Galera on a hostname for compat with IPv6 addresses

Due to a bug [1] in Galera we can't pass an IPv6 as bind-address,
we pass an hostname instead.

1. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1298671

Change-Id: Ia5a5b66dd3e94d3dfb6588550fcfe34382897c27
(cherry picked from commit 3ad9509286e75886e2870ff8ae7b3d282fe97581)

subject: Enable per-role SchedulerHints
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 17:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable per-role SchedulerHints

This adds a parameter for each role, where optional scheduler hints
may be passed to nova.  One potential use-case for this is using
the ComputeCapabilities to pin deployment to a specific node (not
just a specific role/profile mapping to a pool of nodes like we
have currently documented in the ahc-match docs).

This could work as follows:

1. Tag a specific node as "node:controller-0" in Ironic:

ironic node-update <id> replace properties/capabilities='node:controller-0,boot_option:local'

2. Create a heat environment file which uses %index%

parameters:
  ControllerSchedulerHints:
    'capabilities:node': 'controller-%index%'

Change-Id: I79251dde719b4bb5c3b0cce90d0c9d1581ae66f2
(cherry picked from commit 5d61012f86a2e036908a2f7441672e43cbd34790)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable per-role SchedulerHints

This adds a parameter for each role, where optional scheduler hints
may be passed to nova.  One potential use-case for this is using
the ComputeCapabilities to pin deployment to a specific node (not
just a specific role/profile mapping to a pool of nodes like we
have currently documented in the ahc-match docs).

This could work as follows:

1. Tag a specific node as "node:controller-0" in Ironic:

ironic node-update <id> replace properties/capabilities='node:controller-0,boot_option:local'

2. Create a heat environment file which uses %index%

parameters:
  ControllerSchedulerHints:
    'capabilities:node': 'controller-%index%'

Change-Id: I79251dde719b4bb5c3b0cce90d0c9d1581ae66f2
(cherry picked from commit 5d61012f86a2e036908a2f7441672e43cbd34790)

This utilizes the new default_user_data_update_policy option of Heat to
make sure that if user_data property of the OS::Nova::Server resources
changes in the overcloud stack, we don't reprovision the whole cloud
from scratch.

Change-Id: I56b3f2ceb793d549303faada29482c8af4bb8a89

commit_message:
Prevent overcloud reprovisioning on user_data change

This utilizes the new default_user_data_update_policy option of Heat to
make sure that if user_data property of the OS::Nova::Server resources
changes in the overcloud stack, we don't reprovision the whole cloud
from scratch.

Change-Id: I56b3f2ceb793d549303faada29482c8af4bb8a89
Depends-On: I29a2b846f02d5ccdd29b666ed084333580b77465

commit_message:
Add last_request_id parameter to SessionClient

`novaclient.base.Resource.get` method requires manager.client to have
last_request_id member. Otherwise get operation fails with
AttributeError exception.

This patch adds last_request_id member to the SessionClient class

Change-Id: I09e5671ec32216deb79864345cc824a4763bcc12
Closes-Bug: #1494116

subject: Adds v6 capability to the deploy validation test (pings)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 13:16:33.000000000', 'files': ['validation-scripts/all-nodes.sh'], 'message': 'Adds v6 capability to the deploy validation test (pings)

This changes the ping_controller_ips function in the all-nodes.sh
bash validation script which is run during deployment to check
network connectivity (to fail early).

The main differences are using the v6 routes when it is a v6 address
and using python -c to check if the v6 address is in the network and
(thanks emachi!) using ping6 instead of ping.

Closes-Bug: 1534578
Change-Id: Id41950f767e11884b4123fcb0bd2339636fdda68
(cherry picked from commit 45be848991eb2da0ed039dcaa457800b8ed3f314)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds v6 capability to the deploy validation test (pings)

This changes the ping_controller_ips function in the all-nodes.sh
bash validation script which is run during deployment to check
network connectivity (to fail early).

The main differences are using the v6 routes when it is a v6 address
and using python -c to check if the v6 address is in the network and
(thanks emachi!) using ping6 instead of ping.

Closes-Bug: 1534578
Change-Id: Id41950f767e11884b4123fcb0bd2339636fdda68
(cherry picked from commit 45be848991eb2da0ed039dcaa457800b8ed3f314)

commit_message:
Support adding a swap file to overcloud nodes

Create a new SoftwareDeployment that can be used to add a swap file to
all nodes The amount of swap and the location of the swap file can be
customized via parameter_defaults and the swap_size_megabytes/swap_path
parameters.

Change-Id: I1fb14c0fab2255410fceb26c3a7d5cfe0ba57b3b

commit_message:
Disable angular wizard finish button when clicked

The finish button may be pressed multiple times before the wizard
is closed, causing the underlying action to be invoked multiple
times. This patch disables the button before invoking the action,
re-enabling it if there is some error completing the action.

Closes-Bug: 1520598
Change-Id: If3363f6115af2a949f720eb3833dec405e986308

subject: Rename the downstream remote 'gerrithub'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 11:51:43.000000000', 'files': ['.gitreview'], 'message': "Rename the downstream remote 'gerrithub'

Having a clear differenciation between the branches that will be part of
the upstream repository and the downstream one will allow us to work
upstream and downstream using the same local repository. However, since
gerrit uses 'gerrit' name as the default gerrit repo, we need to rename
the downstream one as 'gerrithub'. The `git review` call will need to
add the option `-r gerrithub` when we want to push downstream.

Change-Id: I0cd49af290b006e2151d3829943e7024538fa869
"}]
commit_message:
Rename the downstream remote 'gerrithub'

Having a clear differenciation between the branches that will be part of
the upstream repository and the downstream one will allow us to work
upstream and downstream using the same local repository. However, since
gerrit uses 'gerrit' name as the default gerrit repo, we need to rename
the downstream one as 'gerrithub'. The `git review` call will need to
add the option `-r gerrithub` when we want to push downstream.

Change-Id: I0cd49af290b006e2151d3829943e7024538fa869

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-29 22:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_event.py', 'heatclient/osc/v1/event.py', 'heatclient/common/event_utils.py'], 'message': "Implement stack event list --follow

This adds a --follow option which is similar to the --wait logging
behaviour in changes like I72421c1adf9220e3440179fec672f49803a6cde2
except that --follow doesn't exit until the user does ctrl-c.

This change also includes:
- always sort events ascending for all formatters - the newest events
  should always be at the bottom of the screen as they are generally the
  most interesting
- get_event marker handling tolerates the marker not being in the event
  list. --follow was triggering this, but ignoring the marker in this
  case has not lead to events being printed more than once

Change-Id: Ie0964918fc1d05e7e18aa39ceea6d4777deeb87e
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient
"}]
commit_message:
Implement stack event list --follow

This adds a --follow option which is similar to the --wait logging
behaviour in changes like I72421c1adf9220e3440179fec672f49803a6cde2
except that --follow doesn't exit until the user does ctrl-c.

This change also includes:
- always sort events ascending for all formatters - the newest events
  should always be at the bottom of the screen as they are generally the
  most interesting
- get_event marker handling tolerates the marker not being in the event
  list. --follow was triggering this, but ignoring the marker in this
  case has not lead to events being printed more than once

Change-Id: Ie0964918fc1d05e7e18aa39ceea6d4777deeb87e
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Make keyboard input code more generic

This patch moves the generic code needed for sending keyboard input to
the distro installer from virtualbox-functions to functions-host. The
functions are renamed accordingly.

The VirtualBox-specific scanlib is renamed to virtualbox-keycodes.

Change-Id: I43f25d0c091c17a0e9372449bd16ac8c19039f35

This change adds the ability to configure specific
apache::vhost::headers via puppet-keystone.

In our deployment, we use this to configure:

    keystone::wsgi::apache::headers:
      - 'set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=15552000"'
      - 'set X-Frame-Options "DENY"'

Change-Id: I0d1ca6b11d9ba5b03c92dff728e0edc3bd06cc19
Signed-off-by: Martin Millnert <martin@millnert.se>
Closes-Bug: #1551801
'}]
commit_message:
Make apache::vhost::headers configuration possible

This change adds the ability to configure specific
apache::vhost::headers via puppet-keystone.

In our deployment, we use this to configure:

    keystone::wsgi::apache::headers:
      - 'set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=15552000"'
      - 'set X-Frame-Options "DENY"'

Change-Id: I0d1ca6b11d9ba5b03c92dff728e0edc3bd06cc19
Signed-off-by: Martin Millnert <martin@millnert.se>
Closes-Bug: #1551801

subject: Use arp as fallback for KVM IP database
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 07:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/kvm-functions.sh'], 'message': 'Use arp as fallback for KVM IP database

With KVM, we use a text database that links hostnames and IP addresses.
Since the database is destroyed at the start of each osbash run and the
entries are added (by node_to_ip) whenever a new node is created, we can
safely assume that the entries exist and are correct when we needed them
at a later point (in ssh_env_for_node).

The assumption would not hold, however, if we were restarting a build
from a snapshot, which the KVM backend is due to support soon.

To cover this and possibly other cases, this patch makes ssh_env_for_node
call node_to_ip if an entry or the database file are missing.

Change-Id: Ia6b2fd2d931a20b4f084292e617894cb35900978
'}]
commit_message:
Use arp as fallback for KVM IP database

With KVM, we use a text database that links hostnames and IP addresses.
Since the database is destroyed at the start of each osbash run and the
entries are added (by node_to_ip) whenever a new node is created, we can
safely assume that the entries exist and are correct when we needed them
at a later point (in ssh_env_for_node).

The assumption would not hold, however, if we were restarting a build
from a snapshot, which the KVM backend is due to support soon.

To cover this and possibly other cases, this patch makes ssh_env_for_node
call node_to_ip if an entry or the database file are missing.

Change-Id: Ia6b2fd2d931a20b4f084292e617894cb35900978

commit_message:
Added specification for ZHAW load consolidation

This specification focuses on integration of the
rudimentary load consolidation mechanism developed at ZHAW
with Watcher.

Modifications to take into account feedback from acabot, jwcroppe.

Further modifications to pass tox tests and also taking into account
further feedback from review.

commit_message:
lvm snapshot unique name

The freezer-agent generates unique names for lvm snapshots and
relative mount point, unless provided with a specific value by the user.

The behavior is basically the same, the only change is to the default
values of the following parameters which now use a uuid-generated string:

  --lvm-dirmount
  --lvm-snapname

Implements blueprint lvm-unique-names

Change-Id: I52c3557b64515e3139cc5e453ae1309c84c9b36e

subject: download method shouldn't download all object
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-29 19:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': "download method shouldn't download all object

in python-swiftclient/swiftclient/service.py,
there is a method
def download(self, container=None, objects=None, options=None):

if container is specified but objects not, it download all
objects in specified container.
if both container and objects are specified, it download all
specified objects in the container.

when it comes to the case that, objects argument is specified,
but it turned out to be empty array [ ], the download method
download all the objects under specified container.
this may be not reasonable.

for example,
the objects was not empty when it came from command line,
but it's filtered, maybe by --prefix argument.
at last, it turned out to be empty array.

when calling download method with objects arguments
being empty array, we should download nothing instead of
all the objects under the specified container.

Change-Id: I81aab935533a50b40679c8b3575f298c285233a8
Closes-bug: #1549881
"}]
commit_message:
download method shouldn't download all object

in python-swiftclient/swiftclient/service.py,
there is a method
def download(self, container=None, objects=None, options=None):

if container is specified but objects not, it download all
objects in specified container.
if both container and objects are specified, it download all
specified objects in the container.

when it comes to the case that, objects argument is specified,
but it turned out to be empty array [ ], the download method
download all the objects under specified container.
this may be not reasonable.

for example,
the objects was not empty when it came from command line,
but it's filtered, maybe by --prefix argument.
at last, it turned out to be empty array.

when calling download method with objects arguments
being empty array, we should download nothing instead of
all the objects under the specified container.

Change-Id: I81aab935533a50b40679c8b3575f298c285233a8
Closes-bug: #1549881

oslotest.BaseTestCase is going to be deprecated / removed in favor of using
the provided fixtures. oslotest.BaseTestCase does unnatural things with mock
cleanup that can't be fixed in a backwards-compatible way and we don't want
this odd cleanup or deprecation affecting our tests. See [1].

oslotest.BaseTestCase set up some fixtures that keystone didn't use:

 - timeout.Timeout
 - output.CaptureOutput
 - oslotest.log.ConfigureLogging

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280757/

Change-Id: I5d926fba83f0390fe06e75614d85d87d2cb9f285
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using oslotest.BaseTestCase

oslotest.BaseTestCase is going to be deprecated / removed in favor of using
the provided fixtures. oslotest.BaseTestCase does unnatural things with mock
cleanup that can't be fixed in a backwards-compatible way and we don't want
this odd cleanup or deprecation affecting our tests. See [1].

oslotest.BaseTestCase set up some fixtures that keystone didn't use:

 - timeout.Timeout
 - output.CaptureOutput
 - oslotest.log.ConfigureLogging

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280757/

Change-Id: I5d926fba83f0390fe06e75614d85d87d2cb9f285

commit_message:
Adding Resource Type registration

This patch adds to the registry service to allow for resource types
to have their properties registered with configuration information.

It provides various convenience methods for outputting the property
labels and values, all determined through the registry, and provides
for singular and plural names to be defined.

This patch also registers many of the OpenStack resource types so
they may be used by implementations.  Ideally those are broken into
component modules, but until those are written they can reside here.

Change-Id: I71bebe253452944ff518f85b8840cfe921602544
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-01 14:57:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Use new inventory schema in compute_node_get_all()

In order to allow the scheduler to continue to function exactly the same
as it currently does during the time period while we migrate the data
and schema from the legacy layout to the resource-providers database
schema, we need to ensure that the
nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.compute_node_get_all() method returns all the
existing fields that may store capacity and usage information in the
compute_nodes table *but also* have the method return capacity and usage
information from the new inventories and allocations tables.

This patch adds some fairly complex SQLAlchemy-fu to the
compute_node_get_all() method, joining the compute_nodes table to the
new inventories and allocations tables for the three primary resource
classes currently stored in the compute_nodes table. For RAM, vCPU and
local disk resources, there are additional fields in the returned
results that correspond to the capacity and usage information stored in
the new inventories and allocations table.

For the RAM resource, the following fields are returned:

 * memory_mb <-- legacy compute_nodes.memory_mb field
 * memory_mb_used <-- legacy compute_nodes.memory_mb_used field
 * ram_allocation_ratio <-- legacy compute_nodes.ram_allocation_field
 * inv_memory_mb <-- new inventories.total field value for the MEMORY_MB
   resource class for that compute node
 * inv_memory_mb_reserved <-- new inventories.reserved field value for
   the MEMORY_MB resource class
 * inv_memory_mb_used <-- SUM() of the allocations.used field values for
   the MEMORY_MB resource class for that compute node

Similar fields for vCPU and local disk are returned for those resource
classes.

All of the inv_XXX fields are None if the inventory for the compute node
has not been migrated from the compute_nodes table to the inventories
table. In this way, the data migration on the ComputeNode object now has
the ability to tell if a compute node has had its inventory and usage
information migrated to the new resource-providers schema.

Change-Id: Idc369310cd8efd8181126f6ae6272f5c835e0299
Partially-implements: compute-node-inventory
'}]
commit_message:
Use new inventory schema in compute_node_get_all()

In order to allow the scheduler to continue to function exactly the same
as it currently does during the time period while we migrate the data
and schema from the legacy layout to the resource-providers database
schema, we need to ensure that the
nova.db.sqlalchemy.api.compute_node_get_all() method returns all the
existing fields that may store capacity and usage information in the
compute_nodes table *but also* have the method return capacity and usage
information from the new inventories and allocations tables.

This patch adds some fairly complex SQLAlchemy-fu to the
compute_node_get_all() method, joining the compute_nodes table to the
new inventories and allocations tables for the three primary resource
classes currently stored in the compute_nodes table. For RAM, vCPU and
local disk resources, there are additional fields in the returned
results that correspond to the capacity and usage information stored in
the new inventories and allocations table.

For the RAM resource, the following fields are returned:

 * memory_mb <-- legacy compute_nodes.memory_mb field
 * memory_mb_used <-- legacy compute_nodes.memory_mb_used field
 * ram_allocation_ratio <-- legacy compute_nodes.ram_allocation_field
 * inv_memory_mb <-- new inventories.total field value for the MEMORY_MB
   resource class for that compute node
 * inv_memory_mb_reserved <-- new inventories.reserved field value for
   the MEMORY_MB resource class
 * inv_memory_mb_used <-- SUM() of the allocations.used field values for
   the MEMORY_MB resource class for that compute node

Similar fields for vCPU and local disk are returned for those resource
classes.

All of the inv_XXX fields are None if the inventory for the compute node
has not been migrated from the compute_nodes table to the inventories
table. In this way, the data migration on the ComputeNode object now has
the ability to tell if a compute node has had its inventory and usage
information migrated to the new resource-providers schema.

Change-Id: Idc369310cd8efd8181126f6ae6272f5c835e0299
Partially-implements: compute-node-inventory

commit_message:
Added test for check associate/disassociate actions for floating ip

commit_message:
remove pyc files before running tests

pyc files for old code files and test files won't get removed from the
local tree when those files are removed. They will still be discovered
and used when running tox tests.

This removes pyc files before running tests to ensure that test
results are repeatble by end users even if they are updating older git
trees.

Closes-Bug: #1551312

Change-Id: I9987cc57dc9ac2bd0331af6cb59e2c5e137d9849

commit_message:
Notify about port create/update unconditionally

The notification about port create/update should be done no matter
if host (or any other field) was changed or not - it should be up to
handler to decide how to handle it.

This also fixes the bug when there was actually no notification to l3
dvr agent on compute node on new port creation:
_get_host_port_if_changed() always returned None - this is a regression
from commit 2ee08c3464c53abaf9bc5493132ad7958611e3b8

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py

Closes-Bug: #1521524
Change-Id: I5bb416d2aaab632526f06a5620c0a4ea96340d21
(cherry picked from commit 87ce73141dddb840ffc523f253fdf87aef11d1c7)

commit_message:
Revert "Do not run keystone bootstrap command"

Partial revert of commit 4a63d8c43d2f50f408cec35049522d366d42b95d.
Do not revert master node part, because keystone package for
master node wasn't update to Mitaka version.

Disable fuel-ci because this patch won't work on ISO with old keystone.

Closes-bug: #1552153

commit_message:
WIP: test - please ignore

Support for abort an ongoing live migration

In Nova API microversion 2.24 there is a new operation which allows to
abort a running live migration.

This change is to enable this feature at the client side implementing a
new method to call the new nova API:
nova live-migration-abort <server_id> <migration_id>

Change-Id: If9c40eff6829f89c4ac8687b8a2151b0bdf269c5

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-16 21:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Build list of enabled os-collect-config collectors

When changing the software_config_transport for an existing server,
os-collect-config will continue using the data from the old transport
which will become increasingly stale and will sometimes mask values from
the new transport.

The default list of collectors in os-collect-config is:
heat_local, ec2, cfn, heat, request, local, zaqar

This change explicitly enables these collectors:
ec2, <current transport>, local

``ec2`` is the nova metadata service, so should always be enabled.

``local`` allows local file overrides - this is generally unused but is
enabled for users who choose to use it for additional config data, or to
override the heat provided data.

``heat_local`` is only used on the first run of an unconfigured
os-collect-config for bootstrapping its own config file, so it can and
should be disabled for subsequent polling.

Change-Id: I9cdb057212c7a4404f6966a55cde9eab5ad86759
Closes-Bug: #1523676
'}]
commit_message:
Build list of enabled os-collect-config collectors

When changing the software_config_transport for an existing server,
os-collect-config will continue using the data from the old transport
which will become increasingly stale and will sometimes mask values from
the new transport.

The default list of collectors in os-collect-config is:
heat_local, ec2, cfn, heat, request, local, zaqar

This change explicitly enables these collectors:
ec2, <current transport>, local

``ec2`` is the nova metadata service, so should always be enabled.

``local`` allows local file overrides - this is generally unused but is
enabled for users who choose to use it for additional config data, or to
override the heat provided data.

``heat_local`` is only used on the first run of an unconfigured
os-collect-config for bootstrapping its own config file, so it can and
should be disabled for subsequent polling.

Change-Id: I9cdb057212c7a4404f6966a55cde9eab5ad86759
Closes-Bug: #1523676

commit_message:
VIF port config versioned objects and driver plugin library

Define a standalone os-vif python library, inspired by os-brick,
to provide a versioned object model for data passed from neutron
to nova for VIF port binding, and an API to allow vendors to
provide custom plug/unplug actions for execution by Nova.

Previously-Approved: Mitaka
Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Iaaccba7432d51181a96ea7b01ba353c178f49e69

commit_message:
Add support for OracleLinux (RedHat family)

Update l23network module to support OracleLinux.
Deployment cases are the same as for centos and redhat.

Additional changes:
  * remove installation of cpufreq-init package.
    It doesn't exist anymore for CentOS.
  * update README with list of supported OS

Blueprint: oracle-linux-compute-nodes

Change-Id: Icba00728422326361208cd5a40a753e0310409d3

Heat integration test test_encryption_vol_type will not work in environments
where admin user is named differently or does not have the same password as
that of the demo user.

The admin credentials is now made available via heat_integrationtests.conf.
The tests which require admin privileges should be run only if admin
credentials are available and use the same.

Closes-Bug: #1546993

commit_message:
Fix test_encryption_vol_type to take admin creds from conf

Heat integration test test_encryption_vol_type will not work in environments
where admin user is named differently or does not have the same password as
that of the demo user.

The admin credentials is now made available via heat_integrationtests.conf.
The tests which require admin privileges should be run only if admin
credentials are available and use the same.

Change-Id: I5f329be6d4c4249763e0aec8696fb87605a0812a
Closes-Bug: #1546993

Add fuel-ui repo to ISO build process

Though build packages during ISO build is going to depracate
we still need to align all fuel packages build flow

For replication when we failover and disable a service we want

backend_id during init.

Change-Id: I24ad4f282c3795e971bfafd110ade73891d7f096
'}]
commit_message:
Get disabled services on init

For replication when we failover and disable a service we want
to be able to let a replicated backend come back online, so make
sure we use an appropriate db query for services and pass in the
backend_id during init.

Change-Id: I24ad4f282c3795e971bfafd110ade73891d7f096

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-01 23:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_driver_factory.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/common/driver_factory.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/base_manager.py'], 'message': "Clean up driver loading in init_host

init_host currently sets self._driver_factory and self.drivers, but
those aren't used elsewhere in the code. Don't set them as instance
attributes, but rather let them be discarded after init_host.

Additionally, BaseConductorManager._get_driver appears to be a copy of
driver_factory.get_driver; just proxy over to the driver_factory method
instead.

As tests appear to enforce ordering of the drivers in init_host, use an
OrderedDict in driver_factory.drivers() to maintain this. I don't
believe this is required for correctness, however I don't intend to
change behavior in this patch.

Change-Id: I861980d4402a7b0744376c274ce15631547368f3
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up driver loading in init_host

init_host currently sets self._driver_factory and self.drivers, but
those aren't used elsewhere in the code. Don't set them as instance
attributes, but rather let them be discarded after init_host.

Additionally, BaseConductorManager._get_driver appears to be a copy of
driver_factory.get_driver; just proxy over to the driver_factory method
instead.

As tests appear to enforce ordering of the drivers in init_host, use an
OrderedDict in driver_factory.drivers() to maintain this. I don't
believe this is required for correctness, however I don't intend to
change behavior in this patch.

Change-Id: I861980d4402a7b0744376c274ce15631547368f3

commit_message:
Implement base configuration for independent repository

neutron-ha-tool.py.j2 has been updated to resolve flake8 violations.
This includes removing the venv activation code, by implementing the
following change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275279/

Pep8 'E501: line too long' has been added to the ignore list since the
Jinja2 templated shebang line now exceeds 79 characters.

Change-Id: Ib309ee50d75a5386fbc5fb8cd40d8f6733bd7887

commit_message:
Enable builtinGlobals for no-redeclare

This adds the builtinGlobals flag to the no-redeclare rule, which
will throw errors when known globals - such as Object, Array,
window, document, etc - are used as variable names.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-redeclare

commit_message:
Do not pass both port-id and fixed-ip to create server

Nova doesn't allow specify port-id and fixed-ip at the same
time when create server. This patch to avoid this problem
when create internal port by subnet.

Also, this change adds integration test for create server
with subnet and fixed_ip.

Change-Id: Ib16d7f90a4eb488a853f9c2093280596fc4d783b
Partial-Bug: #1533074
(cherry picked from commit 84564a3665b07c13b4e3909a7d7949388c1f5c6c)

subject: Fix tests checking for nova-compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 16:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/test/launch_instance_private_net.sh'], 'message': 'Fix tests checking for nova-compute

This patch improves the code in launch_instance_private_net that waits
for nova-compute services:

1) It fixes a bug introduced in commit cb70154499f (Get admin credentials
   for service list) which changed the grep pattern but not the loop
   condition which should have switched from "while" to "until". The
   bug was hidden by a race: if the service were up already for the
   first test a few lines above, the buggy code was not executed. If
   the service were still down by the time of the second test, the
   failing test was taken as a success. Only if the service came up
   between these two tests did the loop hang forever.

2) Another test for nova-compute is changed in the same way: test
   for a sign of success rather for the absense of a sign of failure
   (which could also be due to a complete failure of the command).

3) The first test for nova-compute is made more strict by making the
   matching string longer.

Change-Id: I3728f89bd0011d40a88cdee9088cc580cecc87bb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tests checking for nova-compute

This patch improves the code in launch_instance_private_net that waits
for nova-compute services:

1) It fixes a bug introduced in commit cb70154499f (Get admin credentials
   for service list) which changed the grep pattern but not the loop
   condition which should have switched from "while" to "until". The
   bug was hidden by a race: if the service were up already for the
   first test a few lines above, the buggy code was not executed. If
   the service were still down by the time of the second test, the
   failing test was taken as a success. Only if the service came up
   between these two tests did the loop hang forever.

2) Another test for nova-compute is changed in the same way: test
   for a sign of success rather for the absense of a sign of failure
   (which could also be due to a complete failure of the command).

3) The first test for nova-compute is made more strict by making the
   matching string longer.

Change-Id: I3728f89bd0011d40a88cdee9088cc580cecc87bb

commit_message:
Return 409 instead of 503 when cidr conflict

In create a network in nova-network, we should check
whether it's a conflict cidr ,but we reported 503
service unavailable to user, we should report 409
HTTPConflict.

Closes-Bug: 1541760

Change-Id: I80a07222f44017448d1877d6b821eebe462d9fec

commit_message:
update django_openstack_auth to use publish-to-pypi jobs

We noticed that there was no release announcement job for
django_openstack_auth, and in the process of learning why realized that
they had a custom release pipline that doesn't make sense.

Change-Id: Iad87aac47cf1b3ddd4c30365bbe81306b4403512
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

skip running the dsvm jobs if only files in the releasenotes dir are
changed.

subject: Skip long-running jobs on neutronclient doc changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 04:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip long-running jobs on neutronclient doc changes

Change [1] revealed that we are running tempest or unit tests
on doc changes when there is no need to. This change introduces
a skip-if clause to save nodes and execution time for changes
that only need to be validated on pep8/docs/releasenotes jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282555/

Change-Id: I5467472d82ddcf5dc3be939458840c3c0423526e
'}]
commit_message:
Skip long-running jobs on neutronclient doc changes

Change [1] revealed that we are running tempest or unit tests
on doc changes when there is no need to. This change introduces
a skip-if clause to save nodes and execution time for changes
that only need to be validated on pep8/docs/releasenotes jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282555/

Change-Id: I5467472d82ddcf5dc3be939458840c3c0423526e

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox fail even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.

Related bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1465086

Change-Id: Ibeb7840efb135102089882dfd666d3e0854157bf

subject: Write the compute upgrade script for tripleo major upgrade workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 11:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': 'Write the compute upgrade script for tripleo major upgrade workflow

As part of the major upgrade workflow non-controller nodes are to
be updated by the operator, out-of-band and only after an initial
heat stack-update that invokes the upgrade of the controller nodes.

This review adds a ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfigDeployment_Step3
SoftwareDeploymentGroup to be applied only to compute nodes, and
that depends on the controllers having been upgraded after
ControllerPacemakerUpgradeConfig_Step2.

Its purpose is to deliver but not invoke the upgrade script on
compute nodes to /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh .

The non-controller nodes will then be upgraded later by an
operator that will run the script provided for that purpose, like
at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284722/1 for example.

Change-Id: Ic6115fc8cf5320abfcf500112ff563bde8b88661
(cherry picked from commit 55f603b7364387e8c7f9b6b67747a5fddf6e91d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Write the compute upgrade script for tripleo major upgrade workflow

As part of the major upgrade workflow non-controller nodes are to
be updated by the operator, out-of-band and only after an initial
heat stack-update that invokes the upgrade of the controller nodes.

This review adds a ComputeDeliverUpgradeConfigDeployment_Step3
SoftwareDeploymentGroup to be applied only to compute nodes, and
that depends on the controllers having been upgraded after
ControllerPacemakerUpgradeConfig_Step2.

Its purpose is to deliver but not invoke the upgrade script on
compute nodes to /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh .

The non-controller nodes will then be upgraded later by an
operator that will run the script provided for that purpose, like
at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284722/1 for example.

Change-Id: Ic6115fc8cf5320abfcf500112ff563bde8b88661
(cherry picked from commit 55f603b7364387e8c7f9b6b67747a5fddf6e91d4)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 07:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2
"}]
commit_message:
Always override X-Forwarded-Proto header for Heat

Heat has the ssl middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto header by
default. We override this header when SSL is enabled because we need
to, but overriding it even when we won't be terminating SSL will
prevent some attacks using this header.

Change-Id: I0b2c61cd4f47c8c08a84402af310983af752d3f2

commit_message:
Add ngSwift Django Interface

This patch adds the scaffolding for the new angular Swift
interface, but none of the static files for that interface.

The body of the interface will be added in a follow-on
patch.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1921_project_ng_containers_panel.py

Co-Author: Neill Cox <neill@ingenious.com.au>
Change-Id: Icc11167f82554dee31edc465a14be8ebbe435403

commit_message:
Formalise publisher API and create publisher service.

Formalise the publisher API, for both local (inter-process) and network
publishers and subscribers. Create a publisher service to have a single
point of contact binding the TCP port. Add ZMQ driver implementation.

Change-Id: Ib56fae7102ef820b209a7021b5fe76b7c3af16fb

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-06 07:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Schedule creating encrypted volume

Currently Nova doesn't support to attach RBD encrypted volumes
to VM: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206576/. At the other
side, there is bugs to use encrypted volumes from NFS:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1511255

This patch is to allow encrypted volumes in iSCSI and FC backends.

Change-Id: I5301ee41533d2f35d1f69d09019d6fc0d16b7f6f
Closes-Bug: #1520402
"}]
commit_message:
Schedule creating encrypted volume

Currently Nova doesn't support to attach RBD encrypted volumes
to VM: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206576/. At the other
side, there is bugs to use encrypted volumes from NFS:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1511255

This patch is to allow encrypted volumes in iSCSI and FC backends.

Change-Id: I5301ee41533d2f35d1f69d09019d6fc0d16b7f6f
Closes-Bug: #1520402

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-28 07:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "Use isinstance instead of type

With the patch sets of request_ids, the *Manager classes return
'DictWithMeta' or 'ListWithMeta' rather than 'dict' or 'list'.
This change adjust conditional statements to use isinstance when
comparing variables. Isinstance supports inheritance type checking
better than type.

The effected subcommands are:
    evacuate
    interface-list
    interface-attach
    interface-detach

Change-Id: I0c1291110c1386d2ff027cb149a5aff20019e6f7
Closes-Bug: 1550870
"}]
commit_message:
Use isinstance instead of type

With the patch sets of request_ids, the *Manager classes return
'DictWithMeta' or 'ListWithMeta' rather than 'dict' or 'list'.
This change adjust conditional statements to use isinstance when
comparing variables. Isinstance supports inheritance type checking
better than type.

The effected subcommands are:
    evacuate
    interface-list
    interface-attach
    interface-detach

Change-Id: I0c1291110c1386d2ff027cb149a5aff20019e6f7
Closes-Bug: 1550870

commit_message:
Remove support for building unsupported MapR versions

Support for bulding images for MapR 3.1.1 4.0.1 4.0.2
and mapr-spark must be removed since Sahara does not
support these versions in Mitaka release

Implements: blueprint deprecate-old-mapr-versions

To support cross-pod security group, we need to divide rule with

commit_message:
Add RPC handler for security group

To support cross-pod security group, we need to divide rule with
remote_group_id into rules with remote_ip_prefix since security
group id can not cross pods, so we add the following RPC handlers
to support.

(1) Given a port, find the security gruop rules associated with
it, and retrieve IP addresses in the remote groups of those rules.
So when a port is added, we know what IP addresses to allowed to
access the port. This is already implemented in Neutron plugin so
we just inherit the proper base class.

(2) Given a port, retrieve security groups that use its security
group as the remote group. So when a port is added, we can update
those security groups to add new rule to allow the new port to
access.

Security group management will be implemented in later patch.

Change-Id: Id71e655e8d6b1a4e8670eddc7d379d0c6a7998bc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 10:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Add HostnameMap to allow granular control of hostnames

Some operators desire more granular control of hostnames than is
currently possible via the *HostnameFormat parameters, in particular
mapping nodes to explicit IDs (such as inventory references) is not
easily possible.

So, add a HostnameMap parameter, which is optional and allows
explicit overriding of the default hostnames.

E.g pass an environment like this:

parameter_defaults:
  HostnameMap:
    overcloud-controller-0: overcloud-controller-prod-123-0
    overcloud-controller-1: overcloud-controller-prod-456-0
    overcloud-controller-2: overcloud-controller-prod-789-0

Note this is mapping is global (for all roles), because we
expect the keys to be unique given that they include the
role name and index by default.

Note that this depends on a fix for heat bug #1539737

Change-Id: Ib4d3d40e9523903ebccc06c3e14b2d71d924afa3
Depends-On: Ib934f443a8b8e4f75335a9d8b992e7f86791aa45
'}]
commit_message:
Add HostnameMap to allow granular control of hostnames

Some operators desire more granular control of hostnames than is
currently possible via the *HostnameFormat parameters, in particular
mapping nodes to explicit IDs (such as inventory references) is not
easily possible.

So, add a HostnameMap parameter, which is optional and allows
explicit overriding of the default hostnames.

E.g pass an environment like this:

parameter_defaults:
  HostnameMap:
    overcloud-controller-0: overcloud-controller-prod-123-0
    overcloud-controller-1: overcloud-controller-prod-456-0
    overcloud-controller-2: overcloud-controller-prod-789-0

Note this is mapping is global (for all roles), because we
expect the keys to be unique given that they include the
role name and index by default.

Note that this depends on a fix for heat bug #1539737

Change-Id: Ib4d3d40e9523903ebccc06c3e14b2d71d924afa3
Depends-On: Ib934f443a8b8e4f75335a9d8b992e7f86791aa45

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-29 23:17:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/dynamic_creds.py'], 'message': 'Properly handle failures during resource cleanup

The current code that cleans-up network resouces from the dynamic
credentials provider does not account for failures during the
cleanup itself (apart from 404).

When the cleanup is triggered by a failure during the setup, the
original failure is hidden which makes debugging impossible.

Catching all exceptions on cleanup, logging a warning and

'}]
commit_message:
Properly handle failures during resource cleanup

The current code that cleans-up network resouces from the dynamic
credentials provider does not account for failures during the
cleanup itself (apart from 404).

When the cleanup is triggered by a failure during the setup, the
original failure is hidden which makes debugging impossible.

Catching all exceptions on cleanup, logging a warning and
re-rasing the original exception should fix that.

Fixes bug 1551264

Change-Id: I49dbb314a09fd9b49c9604bc8b5b8ed03ff218d4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 16:36:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/core.py'], 'message': "Remove unused domain driver method in legacy wrapper

We have already moved the domain driver methods to the V8
interface (and hence marking them as deprecated). We can also
now remove them from V9 legacy wrapper.

This doesn't affect our support for legacy drivers (since the
wrapper still calls the underlying domain driver methods), but
they are not required in the manager-wrapper interface itself.

Partially Implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: Ib3f9515e79ed17e30f924c05e31bc7a4f2a95fa0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused domain driver method in legacy wrapper

We have already moved the domain driver methods to the V8
interface (and hence marking them as deprecated). We can also
now remove them from V9 legacy wrapper.

This doesn't affect our support for legacy drivers (since the
wrapper still calls the underlying domain driver methods), but
they are not required in the manager-wrapper interface itself.

Partially Implements: blueprint reseller

commit_message:
Change "Reboot Hard" to "Hard Reboot".

While using Horizon, I noticed that the status said "Reboot Pending
Hard".  I think it makes more sense to say "Hard Reboot Pending".
Change this and a couple other similar strings.

Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix delete backup tenant_id error

When we use a api to delete a backup instance,
we should give a tenant_id to decrease quota.
But in the code,the tenant_id that invoke the api,
not the backup instance belongs,so recorrect it.

Close-Bug: #1546935
Change-Id: I022dc7f9d99375ae836875d9ed5f1549084dc51e

subject: Cinderclient is passed broken mock
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8276, 'name': 'kiwik', 'email': 'chenrui.momo@gmail.com', 'username': 'kiwik'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}, {'_account_id': 14937, 'name': 'Tang Chen', 'email': 'imtangchen@163.com', 'username': 'tangchen'}, {'_account_id': 17123, 'name': 'Tom Cocozzello (tjcocozz)', 'email': 'tjcocozz@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tcocozzello'}, {'_account_id': 17211, 'name': 'Brandon Palm', 'email': 'bapalm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'bapalm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-29 21:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/volume/test_find_resource.py'], 'message': "Cinderclient is passed broken mock

Mock for the cinderclient is causing some interesting functionality.
Every time the get() in the VolumeManager is called, mock returns a different
value. The first time it returns the correct value then after that it
falls off the track.

The problem originated from declaring 'side_effect' as a iterator so every
time 'side_effect' was called the return value was dynamically changed [0].
Luckily no one was actually using 'side_effect' for its real use case and
it was used get the correct return value. Instead of using 'side_effect'
incorrectly, 'return_value' should be used instead.

[0]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: Ibdede3eab23f0417fe50284ae92ba912af033a9c
Closes-Bug: #1551252
"}]
commit_message:
Cinderclient is passed broken mock

Mock for the cinderclient is causing some interesting functionality.
Every time the get() in the VolumeManager is called, mock returns a different
value. The first time it returns the correct value then after that it
falls off the track.

The problem originated from declaring 'side_effect' as a iterator so every
time 'side_effect' was called the return value was dynamically changed [0].
Luckily no one was actually using 'side_effect' for its real use case and
it was used get the correct return value. Instead of using 'side_effect'
incorrectly, 'return_value' should be used instead.

[0]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html#the-mock-class

Change-Id: Ibdede3eab23f0417fe50284ae92ba912af033a9c
Closes-Bug: #1551252

Currently 'force_gateway_on_subnet' configuration is set to True
by default and enforces the subnet on to the gateway. With this
fix 'force_gateway_on_subnet' can be changed to False, and
gateway outside the subnet can be added.
Before adding the default route, a route to the gateway IP is
added. This applies to both external and internal networks.

Change-Id: I3a942cf98d263681802729cf09527f06c80fab2b
Closes-Bug: #1335023
Closes-Bug: #1398768
(cherry picked from commit b6126bc0f17f348ff6303b9bd6041cb018479ef9)

commit_message:
Fix for adding gateway with IP outside subnet

Currently 'force_gateway_on_subnet' configuration is set to True
by default and enforces the subnet on to the gateway. With this
fix 'force_gateway_on_subnet' can be changed to False, and
gateway outside the subnet can be added.
Before adding the default route, a route to the gateway IP is
added. This applies to both external and internal networks.

Change-Id: I3a942cf98d263681802729cf09527f06c80fab2b
Closes-Bug: #1335023
Closes-Bug: #1398768
(cherry picked from commit b6126bc0f17f348ff6303b9bd6041cb018479ef9)

commit_message:
[admin-guide]Update a note for viewing all tenant IDs

In liberty, the default identity-api-version is 3. And
the keystone CLI is deprecated in this version. So we
need to use python-openstackclient.

Change-Id: Ic28a3b2173942de48d68c55f3565ea83e0180e03
Closes-Bug: #1551046

commit_message:
Adding ability use default templates

We can use flags -p, -v, -r for specifying plugin, version and
release for testing sahara and will be run default scenarios for a plugin.

Change-Id: Iea65367bc3cffa2198117d245572c7d9a8260eeb

commit_message:
Remove replication v2 calls

With replication v2.1 merged in cinder and the calls merged in the
client, there is no longer a need for the old calls. If these commands
are called with the newest cinder code, it fails miserably.

Basically reverts this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231708

Change-Id: I29c0565c1efe518e40c3483ceb4ca0d40cd7d0d7

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary import lines from scss files

According to following changes in Horizon, some scss
importations become unnecessary.

https://review.openstack.org/277220/

And the above change occurs critical django error, so
dashboards doesn't work.

This patch removes these unnecessary importations.

Change-Id: I6041305710ae5b1832ba708fbc4cc32cf61087cb
Closes-Bug: #1550286

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-29 19:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Disable tempest tox venv recreation in OFFLINE mode

Setting OFFLINE=True in local.conf should enable stack.sh to run multiple
times without an internet connection. This was broken for some cases
when recreation of tox venv for tempest was forced in lib/tempest.

This change makes recreation of tox venv enabled only when OFFLINE mode is
disabled.

Change-Id: I2bf6caf60038a3690378eead905b35e9175ac356
Closes-Bug: #1550537
'}]
commit_message:
Disable tempest tox venv recreation in OFFLINE mode

Setting OFFLINE=True in local.conf should enable stack.sh to run multiple
times without an internet connection. This was broken for some cases
when recreation of tox venv for tempest was forced in lib/tempest.

This change makes recreation of tox venv enabled only when OFFLINE mode is
disabled.

Change-Id: I2bf6caf60038a3690378eead905b35e9175ac356
Closes-Bug: #1550537

This completes the removal of the api_version parameter from
individual rest calls. This is an attribute of the api rest client
itself, and should be set there and have all requests work on that
version.

In order to do that test_server_group had to be pretty substantially
normalized. This set of tests so aggressively used common methods
(including embedded asserts) that assumed a very specific execution
environment and didn't account for other microversion changes. This
expands this back out via copy/paste to decouple these components that
do vary.

Change-Id: I06b0087b755b0d19fb51ef0463d36dd2cac5f044
"}]
commit_message:
complete the removal of api_version from rest client parameters

This completes the removal of the api_version parameter from
individual rest calls. This is an attribute of the api rest client
itself, and should be set there and have all requests work on that
version.

In order to do that test_server_group had to be pretty substantially
normalized. This set of tests so aggressively used common methods
(including embedded asserts) that assumed a very specific execution
environment and didn't account for other microversion changes. This
expands this back out via copy/paste to decouple these components that
do vary.

Change-Id: I06b0087b755b0d19fb51ef0463d36dd2cac5f044

subject: Allow mutable argument to be passed to BinaryObject artifacts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-12 13:13:55.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/glare/definitions.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_glare_type_definition_framework.py'], 'message': "Allow mutable argument to be passed to BinaryObject artifacts

According to spec description [1] binary data should always be
immutable. Before this commit, passing 'mutable' argument lead
to exception, because it was passed to a function twice. This commit
makes BinaryObject's silently ignore mutable=False and raises an
appropriate exception in case mutable=True is passed.

Change-Id: Ib42871004c792b840f8af0316c3b8177c4ecf706
Closes-Bug: #1542430
"}]
commit_message:
Allow mutable argument to be passed to BinaryObject artifacts

According to spec description [1] binary data should always be
immutable. Before this commit, passing 'mutable' argument lead
to exception, because it was passed to a function twice. This commit
makes BinaryObject's silently ignore mutable=False and raises an
appropriate exception in case mutable=True is passed.

Change-Id: Ib42871004c792b840f8af0316c3b8177c4ecf706
Closes-Bug: #1542430

subject: Make debootstrap cache opt-in
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 18:11:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debootstrap/environment.d/50-debootstrap', 'elements/debootstrap/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'elements/debootstrap/README.rst'], 'message': 'Make debootstrap cache opt-in

Whenever we make a debootstrap based image we cache the restuling
rootfs. For the majority of cases this is a wasted expensive operation
(an extra copy of the full rootfs). Lets make it opt-in.

Change-Id: I8f5bd9e5a9b0efdce5cb78ae46afe64f07a3125d
'}]
commit_message:
Make debootstrap cache opt-in

Whenever we make a debootstrap based image we cache the restuling
rootfs. For the majority of cases this is a wasted expensive operation
(an extra copy of the full rootfs). Lets make it opt-in.

Change-Id: I8f5bd9e5a9b0efdce5cb78ae46afe64f07a3125d

commit_message:
Add basic workflow of attach/detach to devref

This is something that confuses folks and isn't centrally
located.  So... add it to the devref docs and hope that
developers read it.

There's tons of detail we can add in the future of course,
but this at least clears up some of the common misconceptions
that exist currently.

Change-Id: Ic5fb8da06d18fac3369a91a525accc75c1d28100

commit_message:
Add extension requirement in port-security api test

if port-security extension is not enabled in neutron, 2 tests run and fail.
Even if port-security is not part of the tempest.conf api_extensions list.

Change-Id: I7c15bff96ea976841400e8df93d0c1cb74049bce
Closes-bug: #1542892
(cherry picked from commit f846519e5af6efa5007896c7ac75d13b415c3f53)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-01 03:20:40.000000000', 'files': ['zaqarclient/queues/v1/pool.py', 'zaqarclient/tests/queues/pool.py'], 'message': 'Update pool on pool create if it exists

As of now on PUT, zaqar server updates pool if
it is already exists else it will create a new one.
However zaqar client return previous pool info if
it is already exists. This result to a confusion for
operator.

The zaqar client should maitain symmetry with zaqar server.

Change-Id: I0e7311321630c3f931cf27b0828394589eaf7320
Partial-Bug: #1532776
'}]
commit_message:
Update pool on pool create if it exists

As of now on PUT, zaqar server updates pool if
it is already exists else it will create a new one.
However zaqar client return previous pool info if
it is already exists. This result to a confusion for
operator.

The zaqar client should maitain symmetry with zaqar server.

Change-Id: I0e7311321630c3f931cf27b0828394589eaf7320
Partial-Bug: #1532776

setuptools.setup(

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in

It's not needed with PBR

As you can see setup.py:
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

So we no longer need MANIFEST.in.

Change-Id: Iadcdae8b796c0ba62a6299a6442ec92e7ed6cc2b

subject: Use slurp to collect the repo_server ssh keys
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-02 03:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_key_distribute.yml', 'tasks/repo_key_populate.yml'], 'message': 'Use slurp to collect the repo_server ssh keys

Extracting the ssh public key using cat and storing the result in a
fact has resulted in periodic failures in the collection of the key,
and thereafter the failure to appropriately place that key into the
authorised_keys file.

This patch changes the collection method to use the Ansible slurp
module which has been found to be more reliable.

Change-Id: I68699e7b59630cc3bc6113285edcb1ab936160ce
'}]
commit_message:
Use slurp to collect the repo_server ssh keys

Extracting the ssh public key using cat and storing the result in a
fact has resulted in periodic failures in the collection of the key,
and thereafter the failure to appropriately place that key into the
authorised_keys file.

This patch changes the collection method to use the Ansible slurp
module which has been found to be more reliable.

Change-Id: I68699e7b59630cc3bc6113285edcb1ab936160ce

subject: Use obj_attr_is_set to check whether an attr is set in oslo_versionedobject
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 15:20:54.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/objects/base.py'], 'message': 'Use obj_attr_is_set to check whether an attr is set in oslo_versionedobject

hasattr() have different behaviour between python 2 and 3 [1], while we can
not fix oslo_versionedobject [2], we need to use obj_attr_is_set to
check whether an attr is set in oslo.versionedobject as their core
suggested [2].

[1]. https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr
     https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285647/

More detailed info, please refer to the launchpad bug page.

Change-Id: I9adbbb55e8560a499e8334e954cc904fb8ee3565
Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
'}]
commit_message:
Use obj_attr_is_set to check whether an attr is set in oslo_versionedobject

hasattr() have different behaviour between python 2 and 3 [1], while we can
not fix oslo_versionedobject [2], we need to use obj_attr_is_set to
check whether an attr is set in oslo.versionedobject as their core
suggested [2].

[1]. https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr
     https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
[2]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285647/

More detailed info, please refer to the launchpad bug page.

Change-Id: I9adbbb55e8560a499e8334e954cc904fb8ee3565
Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3

commit_message:
Removed sshd_config file

This file is an oversight and should not be here. The file is adding the
option "UseDNS no" to the base config and while this is an option that
could be set, this is not something that this role needs or should be
doing.  This issue was pointed out in the course of Bug: #1549379 being
worked on.

Change-Id: I4c184b0967d67e431b5b4e33172522c49459a3eb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
"group" word should be used instead "pool"

Currently, when creating a new flavor, here
it need to set pool group name for the first
argument "pool".
For making clear between a pool and pool group,
So we should replace "pool" word with "pool_group"
at all the places.

According the discussion in IRC, for giving users time
to mirgate, we will support 'pool' and 'pool_group'
both in M, and will remove 'pool' in N.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Id4c976a1fc9cc7fb9b72482b4e3a7f7f80f94492
Closes-Bug: #1504959

subject: Make security-group-rule-create accept "any" protocol
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-01-25 00:57:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Make security-group-rule-create accept "any" protocol

specified the protocol. This change makes security-group-rule-create
accept protocol "any" to allow user explictly specify 'any' protocol,
and keep behavior consistent with FWaaS CLI and outputs of
"neutron security-group-rule-list".

Closes-Bug: #1470051
Closes-Bug: #1469642

Change-Id: I14a31458f5c97aea356c7afe083e13fd6f79c2df
'}]
commit_message:
Make security-group-rule-create accept "any" protocol

Currently, all protocols are allowed only when user do not
specified the protocol. This change makes security-group-rule-create
accept protocol "any" to allow user explictly specify 'any' protocol,
and keep behavior consistent with FWaaS CLI and outputs of
"neutron security-group-rule-list".

Closes-Bug: #1470051
Closes-Bug: #1469642

Change-Id: I14a31458f5c97aea356c7afe083e13fd6f79c2df

commit_message:
To tag all the Admin-only APIs as Admin only

Currently, issuing manila help command, lists all APIs.
Therefore, there is no way to identify which is admin-only
and which is not. Fixed by tagging the admin-only api
as (Admin only) in help text.

Change-Id: I0f676901675b8d57e16c4275c5b579fcfa0ca2ae
Closes-Bug: #1457155

commit_message:
Remove aggressive assert from share server test

The delete_share_server test has an assert which can
fail in case of retries and give a false negative result.
This assert isn't necessary to check for correctness, so
remove it.

Closes-bug: 1546618

Change-Id: Ib04afdc222e19725df4da0793c1ffcc15282a772

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-27 21:51:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/ssh_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_ssh_utils.py'], 'message': '"fix sshpool.remove code"

currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken.

The function tries to locate the passed in sshclient object inside
sshpool.free_items.
However, since the sshclient object is set to ‚Äúnone‚Äù at the beginning,
it never finds the object and ends up with decrementing the current
size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to ‚ÄòNone‚Äô so that the attempt to locate object goes
through.
2. fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(sh)
3. also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match is
found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: Ic5bf5b432453361c9059e57a7b489a0ee3fd726e
Closes-Bug: 1463557
'}]
commit_message:
"fix sshpool.remove code"

currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken.

The function tries to locate the passed in sshclient object inside
sshpool.free_items.
However, since the sshclient object is set to ‚Äúnone‚Äù at the beginning,
it never finds the object and ends up with decrementing the current
size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to ‚ÄòNone‚Äô so that the attempt to locate object goes
through.
2. fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(sh)
3. also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match is
found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: Ic5bf5b432453361c9059e57a7b489a0ee3fd726e
Closes-Bug: 1463557

commit_message:
remove containers on delete

This patch calls client.remove_container after a container has stopped
running in response to client.kill.

In the event that a container is created with an explict name, as in:

  docker_dbserver:
    type: "DockerInc::Docker::Container"
    properties:
      image: mysql
      name: dbserver

Failure to remove the container on delete will prevent the stack from being
re-deployed.

Change-Id: Ic864d1a808b303fcb58815b87e55a0e7d1639bbb
closes-bug: #1364019

commit_message:
Allow str_replace to reference parameters/attributes

Currently a validation error occurs if you attempt to reference
via get_param or get_attr when using str_replace, however if
we avoid the explicit validation in the constructor it actually
works fine, and we already have a validation to handle any
invalid input elsewhere in the function definition.

This is a combination of two commits,
0d109b75d9a0d6e043bd8f513943d3d107050483 and
0b8d03a840c3070f3ffecd093adff6a7f1a02c33 - the latter fixed
some issues with the initial patch and test.

Closes-Bug: #1539737
(cherry picked from commit 0d109b75d9a0d6e043bd8f513943d3d107050483
and commit 0b8d03a840c3070f3ffecd093adff6a7f1a02c33)
Change-Id: Ib934f443a8b8e4f75335a9d8b992e7f86791aa45

The heat-cfn-api wasn't handling the RequestLimitExceeded error.
Instead it returned generic "Internal Server Error". The fix is to
correctly map RequestLimitedExceeded exception in heat-cfn-api.
Added unit test to verify mapping of RequestLimitExceeded error.

Change-Id: I6e13b2f6b1458fb7c194632db67eb2cebdb173d2
Closes-Bug: #1542559
'}]
commit_message:
Map RequestLimitExceeded exception in heat-cfn-api

The heat-cfn-api wasn't handling the RequestLimitExceeded error.
Instead it returned generic "Internal Server Error". The fix is to
correctly map RequestLimitedExceeded exception in heat-cfn-api.
Added unit test to verify mapping of RequestLimitExceeded error.

Change-Id: I6e13b2f6b1458fb7c194632db67eb2cebdb173d2
Closes-Bug: #1542559

commit_message:
NUMATopologyFilter raise exception and not continue filter next node

NUMATopologyFilter raise exception and not continue filter next node
when there is no wanted pagesize in current filtered host.

Catch MemoryPageSizeNotSupported exception to prevent this exception
suspend procedure of filter hosts.

Change-Id: Ice092c871beeca5de2fa6bbf274240f4db508008
Closes-Bug: 1473308

commit_message:
Fix jitter strategies

Seems like the wrong function signature was being decorated
so this fixes that and adds an initial test to make sure it
continues to work as expected.

Also fixes the invalid usage of random in the jitter
decorator.

update_access during a share delete workflow to remove all the

commit_message:
Fix NetApp cDOT driver update_access negative test

A negative internal Tempest test somehow didn't catch a problem
with the recent update_access patch. If a flexvol is deleted on
cDOT without Manila's knowledge, deleting the corresponding Manila
share should still succeed. The core update_access changes call
update_access during a share delete workflow to remove all the
existing rules, and that path in the cDOT driver needs to be
hardened against the cases where either share or share server
no longer exist.  Also, fix a mis-named lock object in the same
code path.

Change-Id: Ibb88c64ddd899c09cd148f398e21ac613be9f15b
Closes-Bug: #1549518

commit_message:
Ensure to_dict() supports unicode

When we compose a string for user_identity, we should
ensure that we don't break for non-ascii strings in
user name or tenant name or domain names.

Change-Id: Id457ebe415f78c435fc8ece810f0a1b20964dabf
Closes-Bug: #1507937

commit_message:
Ignore TypeErrors on old properties during update

Extend the approach from 1cfde62b2ff8a60c8cc3a9ef4926e5f4a7116aee of
ignoring ValueErrors in the _previous_ properties when doing an update to
also ignoring TypeErrors.

Change-Id: Ic08165fe031e1764cfb34eaf782d3e105f04fee3
Closes-Bug: #1538551

commit_message:
Service driver support in L2gw for south bound

The patch set provides a framework to support
service drivers so that the south bound implementation
need not be tied to only the L2gw agent communicating
over the RabbitMQ message bus. This will help to support
other types of south bound implementations like OpenDaylight.

Change-Id: I403c7c0f110d4ad95d803640508b78c1539d181f
Closes-Bug: 1478812
Author: Maruti  <maruti.kamat@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Manjunath Patil <mpatil@hp.com>

commit_message:
Fix some wrong strings in ko_KR docs index page

1. 'Ïò§Ïã†Í≤ÉÏùÑ' must have a space between 'Ïò§Ïã†' and 'Í≤ÉÏùÑ'
2. <sting> -> '<strong>'
3. A meaningless grave accent exists
4. elaborate an ambiguous expression more concisely
5. remove a period which is not used in the base document
6. 'Í¥ÄÏã¨ÏûàÏúºÏã†Í∞ÄÏöî' has to have a space between 'Í¥ÄÏã¨' and 'ÏûàÏúºÏã†Í∞ÄÏöî'

As index page is like a face of this project, any trivial spelling error
cannot be allowed.

Change-Id: Ie769e23bce348ddbe7c233a59c82fe7c51748057

subject: Raise AttributeError instead of NotImplementedError
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-29 19:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Raise AttributeError instead of NotImplementedError

hasattr() will use object's getter to determine if a attr exists.
In python3, only AttributeError is checked:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
If we raise other exception like NotImplementedError, the program
will exit due to the exception.

In python2, any exception is ok, so change to AttributeError will
make no regressions on python2.7.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr

Magnum uses oslo_versionedobjects as it's base object, and it will
rely on the hasattr() to generate object attr dict. Before this patch
we got error when trying to generate object dict on python34 test:
'    _("Cannot load \'%s\' in the base class") % attrname)'
"NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'id' in the base class
http://logs.openstack.org/93/285693/3/check/gate-magnum-python34/960581a/console.html
Tha patch fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
Change-Id: I0ce4132bbd80e71e8ba34a0e4da806c98892f828
'}]
commit_message:
Raise AttributeError instead of NotImplementedError

hasattr() will use object's getter to determine if a attr exists.
In python3, only AttributeError is checked:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#hasattr
If we raise other exception like NotImplementedError, the program
will exit due to the exception.

In python2, any exception is ok, so change to AttributeError will
make no regressions on python2.7.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr

Magnum uses oslo_versionedobjects as it's base object, and it will
rely on the hasattr() to generate object attr dict. Before this patch
we got error when trying to generate object dict on python34 test:
'    _("Cannot load \'%s\' in the base class") % attrname)'
"NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'id' in the base class
http://logs.openstack.org/93/285693/3/check/gate-magnum-python34/960581a/console.html
Tha patch fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1551394
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-python3
Change-Id: I0ce4132bbd80e71e8ba34a0e4da806c98892f828

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-03-01 15:50:12.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/cmd/test_db_cleanup.py', 'barbican/tests/database_utils.py', 'barbican/tests/tasks/test_certificate_resources.py', 'barbican/model/clean.py', 'barbican/cmd/db_manage.py'], 'message': "Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage

Adds a simple 'clean' command to barbican-db-manage to
clean up valid soft deletes in the database. It
also includes unit tests which includes
throwing a sql integrity error.

The unit tests did not support foreign key constraints.
database_utils.py and test_certificate_resources.py were
changed to support foreign key constraints during sqllite
testing.

This is the first CR for cleaning up soft deletes in the database.
The list of CRs will be:
1) Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage
2) Make clean up script configurable and create documentation

Change-Id: Ida9507e5c2378ca7ad1e9dbbe5a99b627584a7f8
Partially-implements: blueprint clean-db-soft-deletes
"}]
commit_message:
Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage

Adds a simple 'clean' command to barbican-db-manage to
clean up valid soft deletes in the database. It
also includes unit tests which includes
throwing a sql integrity error.

The unit tests did not support foreign key constraints.
database_utils.py and test_certificate_resources.py were
changed to support foreign key constraints during sqllite
testing.

This is the first CR for cleaning up soft deletes in the database.
The list of CRs will be:
1) Simple soft deletion clean up for barbican-db-manage
2) Make clean up script configurable and create documentation

Change-Id: Ida9507e5c2378ca7ad1e9dbbe5a99b627584a7f8
Partially-implements: blueprint clean-db-soft-deletes

commit_message:
Stop using Hidden property for RandomString

Sequence property was hidden. According to translation rule it now
changed on self.CHARACTER_CLASSES_CLASS property.
As result code in validation and handle_create methods can be removed.
Also unittests was changed to demostrate changes applied for Hidden
property.

Class with TestGenerateRandomString was changed to use new algorithm for
generation random strings.

Change-Id: I3f81df94b24e0f751d2070dc314f15ceb95164ce

subject: Cells: Call compute api methods with instance objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 18:52:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/messaging.py', 'nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_messaging.py'], 'message': "Cells: Call compute api methods with instance objects

When nova-cells processes a 'run_compute_api_method' message it pulls
the instance from the local db and calls the appropriate compute api
method with a sqlalchemy model.  Instead it should populate an instance
object and pass that in.

Change-Id: Ib4fb46310c2a2c1edf378ed3a3fd42421ff4cb47
Closes-bug: #1290975
(cherry picked from commit ca908166dbfc311715e9e10449eb5e93add66a30)
"}]
commit_message:
Cells: Call compute api methods with instance objects

When nova-cells processes a 'run_compute_api_method' message it pulls
the instance from the local db and calls the appropriate compute api
method with a sqlalchemy model.  Instead it should populate an instance
object and pass that in.

Change-Id: Ib4fb46310c2a2c1edf378ed3a3fd42421ff4cb47
Closes-bug: #1290975
(cherry picked from commit ca908166dbfc311715e9e10449eb5e93add66a30)

commit_message:
VMware: Prefer ShutdownGuest to PowerOffVM_Task

PowerOffVM_Task is a dangerous operation, while ShutdownGuest is
more secure. so we use ShutdownGuest instead of PowerOffVM_Task,
if vmtools has been installed.

The patch was originally proposed by "javeme <javaloveme@gmail.com>" in
I61f36c93e0e14a2d98feb9d24cc969081c4d8b14. This is an updated version to
work with the current code base.

Change-Id: I866aa2bcf0ba7d8976de33b19796a52f53068c7f
Closes-Bug: #1445858

subject: Add groups in scoped federated tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-14 06:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py'], 'message': "Add groups in scoped federated tokens

Groups should be added also to project/domain federated tokens.
Rationale behind this is that federated token is an 'identity' of the
ephemeral user and there is no other way to retrieve required
information rather then directly from the token.

We also do a simple refactoring for a better readibility:

dict[x] = obj is used instead of dict.update({a:b})

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py
	keystone/token/providers/common.py

Closes-Bug: 1541657

(cherry picked from commit 31a2f67de4b26ea9e193d94c2cdfddb91afb8098)

Change-Id: I0b11d93836e5737d4d8fdfb5ec0351072eae7329
"}]
commit_message:
Add groups in scoped federated tokens

Groups should be added also to project/domain federated tokens.
Rationale behind this is that federated token is an 'identity' of the
ephemeral user and there is no other way to retrieve required
information rather then directly from the token.

We also do a simple refactoring for a better readibility:

dict[x] = obj is used instead of dict.update({a:b})

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py
	keystone/token/providers/common.py

Closes-Bug: 1541657

(cherry picked from commit 31a2f67de4b26ea9e193d94c2cdfddb91afb8098)

Change-Id: I0b11d93836e5737d4d8fdfb5ec0351072eae7329

commit_message:
Migrations squash

SQL Migrations for Liberty require the schema version to be at 055
which is the final verison for the Juno release. This limits the
change sets that could affect assumptions made in earlier migration
files.

Change-Id: I693f5808306660b37ce2a22f2a5d1dda14cfdbc3
Implements: blueprint liberty-sql-squash
