reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 19985, 'name': 'Ryosuke Mizuno', 'email': 'r-mizuno@rs.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'r-mizuno'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-01 07:05:17.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/091_migrate_data_to_local_user_and_password_tables.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py'], 'message': "Fix the migration issue for the user doesn't have a password

If user doesn't have a password, the migration 091 will fail, this is
because the `password` table doesn't allow the `password`
field to be null.

There is no need to insert an empty entry into `password`
table. The user not reference with any `password` instance will imply
the `user` doesn't have a password.

This patch also fixes the case that the user from `user` table already
exists in `local_user` table and result in `DBDuplicateEntry` exception
due to the bug #1549705.

Change-Id: I4db73ee673573ab63b36bf092c17f8ba64605939
Closes-Bug: #1549705
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the migration issue for the user doesn't have a password

If user doesn't have a password, the migration 091 will fail, this is
because the `password` table doesn't allow the `password`
field to be null.

There is no need to insert an empty entry into `password`
table. The user not reference with any `password` instance will imply
the `user` doesn't have a password.

This patch also fixes the case that the user from `user` table already
exists in `local_user` table and result in `DBDuplicateEntry` exception
due to the bug #1549705.

Change-Id: I4db73ee673573ab63b36bf092c17f8ba64605939
Closes-Bug: #1549705

subject: Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 13055, 'name': 'Alexander Makarov', 'email': 'ajiekcahdp.makapob@gmail.com', 'username': 'amakarov'}, {'_account_id': 16523, 'name': 'ZhangLei', 'display_name': 'ZhangLei', 'email': 'zhang.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhang.lei'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-30 02:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/core.py'], 'message': "Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer

The tests were originally calling keystone.policy.backends.rules:init to
register the oslo_policy options and create the Enforcer instance. We
can't do this because this doesn't give our tests classes the
opportunity to override CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file because the
Enforcer was created at import time.

Instead we'll register the olso_policy options so that we can override
them and let the rule.init() be called at runtime *after* our setUp code
runs.

Change-Id: I5e1129249482361de9ecb3d37e20d149c9558901
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes issue testing with oslo_policy.Enforcer

The tests were originally calling keystone.policy.backends.rules:init to
register the oslo_policy options and create the Enforcer instance. We
can't do this because this doesn't give our tests classes the
opportunity to override CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file because the
Enforcer was created at import time.

Instead we'll register the olso_policy options so that we can override
them and let the rule.init() be called at runtime *after* our setUp code
runs.

Change-Id: I5e1129249482361de9ecb3d37e20d149c9558901

commit_message:
Add policy support to workflow steps

This updates the workflow decorator service to check policy rules to
determine whether or not to display a workflow step. Each workflow
step can have a policy property which specifies the policy rule to
check.

Related to blueprint add-scheduler-hints
Change-Id: Id9270a4f20d785283372c182d178fe9b59e3259b

commit_message:
Add support for ECC signatures

Previously, only RSA-PSS signatures were supported for signature
verification in glance. This patch adds support for verifying
Elliptic Curve Cryptography signatures, including unit tests.

Change-Id: I2f01a2d12b1f35ed13caf0479a4f07add2773dff
Partial-Bug: #1513973

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-13 16:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Adds script that checks for etc/keystone.conf

When\xa0the user runs\xa0keystone-manage, this\xa0script checks for the presence
of ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf. If it is not possible to read or write
the file (e.g., missing file or insufficient permissions), the user is
notified and prompted to either abort the process or copy the contents
from ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.sample
to ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.

Currently, if a user runs keystone_manage (db_sync,\xa0for example), and
either the user has insufficient permissions to read/write
keystone.conf or the file does not exist, the command would have no
effect, yet the user would\xa0not be notified.
This patch would rectify this problem by notifying the user and giving
appropriate options

Change-Id: Ib78a611fde3b8e828d75b3124d4debdff3be5c21
Closes-Bug: #1273273i
'}]
commit_message:
Adds script that checks for etc/keystone.conf

When¬†the user runs¬†keystone-manage, this¬†script checks for the presence
of ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf. If it is not possible to read or write
the file (e.g., missing file or insufficient permissions), the user is
notified and prompted to either abort the process or copy the contents
from ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.sample
to ~/keystone/etc/keystone.conf.

Currently, if a user runs keystone_manage (db_sync,¬†for example), and
either the user has insufficient permissions to read/write
keystone.conf or the file does not exist, the command would have no
effect, yet the user would¬†not be notified.
This patch would rectify this problem by notifying the user and giving
appropriate options

Change-Id: Ib78a611fde3b8e828d75b3124d4debdff3be5c21
Closes-Bug: #1273273i

commit_message:
Use partitions in all DSE2 tests

Change: Make every test that uses DSE2 create and use its own DSE2 partition.
Follows the example of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/283875/

Purpose: Isolate tests so that they do not interfere over the shared bus.
Resolve tox-new_arch failures.

Change-Id: If45150f4e6670f488d2285a517f5e28b3efc8181

commit_message:
Comparision of database models and migrations.

It's would be nice to be sure, that DB state is actually the
same as SQLA models description. This will allows us reduce SQLite
usage, generate initial DB schema from SQLA metadata (not from migrations),
simplify DB migrations, etc.
So, we shouldn't allow declaration of models and migrations with
differences. Furthermore we should take into account all the backends
implementation traits and achieve maximum models and migrations
conformity.

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Pekelny <ipekelny@mirantis.com>

Related-Bug: #1292591
Change-Id: I47444c4944f08535227718e368a1950c45c6cb32

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-06 17:23:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_host.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_firewall.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/host.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_compat.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version

libvirt-python should not be used in the unit tests, fakelibvirt should
be used to avoid test differences depending on the version of
libvirt-python in tox.

However, libvirt-python is required if you're running nova-compute with
the libvirt driver so we should list libvirt-python in
test-requirements.txt as an optional dependency (like oslo.vmware for
the vmware driver).

With this we can pin the minimum required version to 1.2.5 which allows
us to also remove a workaround for libvirt-python < 1.1.2 for
baselineCPU().

Since the driver, host and firewall modules all import libvirt we make
sure the tests using those modules are overwriting their global libvirt
attribute with fakelibvirt for consistent test results.

Change-Id: I22fc334884a90f3331a3fa040e6a0c952f0d7306
"}]
commit_message:
Add libvirt-python to test-requirements.txt to enforce min version

libvirt-python should not be used in the unit tests, fakelibvirt should
be used to avoid test differences depending on the version of
libvirt-python in tox.

However, libvirt-python is required if you're running nova-compute with
the libvirt driver so we should list libvirt-python in
test-requirements.txt as an optional dependency (like oslo.vmware for
the vmware driver).

With this we can pin the minimum required version to 1.2.5 which allows
us to also remove a workaround for libvirt-python < 1.1.2 for
baselineCPU().

Since the driver, host and firewall modules all import libvirt we make
sure the tests using those modules are overwriting their global libvirt
attribute with fakelibvirt for consistent test results.

Change-Id: I22fc334884a90f3331a3fa040e6a0c952f0d7306

Resize operation call compute.manager. Using cast
doesn't allow to notify user that something has
gone wrong. For example, an attempt to resize an instance down
fails silently. The error may only be found in the nova-compute
log file.

In order to return more useful error messages to the end user,
and to allow the operator to better diagnose failures, the resize
operation has been split into two parts. The first part checks
that the instance can indeed be resized, while the second part
performs the actual instance resize operation. The actual resize
operation is performed asynchronously, since the operation can
take a long time, however, the check operation is performed
synchronously, in order to provide better and quicker failure
conditions to the user.

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157
"}]
commit_message:
Split instance resize operation into 2 phases

Resize operation call compute.manager. Using cast
doesn't allow to notify user that something has
gone wrong. For example, an attempt to resize an instance down
fails silently. The error may only be found in the nova-compute
log file.

In order to return more useful error messages to the end user,
and to allow the operator to better diagnose failures, the resize
operation has been split into two parts. The first part checks
that the instance can indeed be resized, while the second part
performs the actual instance resize operation. The actual resize
operation is performed asynchronously, since the operation can
take a long time, however, the check operation is performed
synchronously, in order to provide better and quicker failure
conditions to the user.

Closes-bug: #1455460

Change-Id: Ie814331b9ddaab2762282a45ba1cdc7065f7e157

initially.

Once that gets merged we can re-enable the tests.

commit_message:
Allow monitor plugins to set own object fields

This patchset renames the base monitor plugin get_metric()
abstract method to populate_metric_object() and passes
MontiorMetric object as an additional parameter to the method.
This allows individual monitor plugin to set their MonitorMetric
object fields in their plugin code itself.

Additionally, updated the cpu monitor plugin to reflect the change.

Change-Id: I1e05413486b6ab037887a53f9b54b2470a97d698

Nova commit 322cc9336fe6f6fe9b3f0da33c6b26a3e5ea9b0c added the
neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option in Juno and it defaults
to False.

This will show up a Tempest test for this feature. For now,
this test is skipped if the config option (to be deprecated
in Kilo with Nova change Ideeb3c137ff68a4497189670be33f6edbb0ccb76)
is not set to True. This skip will be removed and

commit_message:
Show up a Tempest test to create 1 instance with multi-nics on same net

Nova commit 322cc9336fe6f6fe9b3f0da33c6b26a3e5ea9b0c added the
neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option in Juno and it defaults
to False.

This will show up a Tempest test for this feature. For now,
this test is skipped if the config option (to be deprecated
in Kilo with Nova change Ideeb3c137ff68a4497189670be33f6edbb0ccb76)
is not set to True. This skip will be removed and
always tested once the config option will be removed in Liberty.

Depends-On: I05f81d86cde249c23be06d5804fadbf40fc4a7f3

Change-Id: I059976e9949c2cc8fa32978ad051b37417650859

commit_message:
apply endpoint_group filters on token catalog

The spec of endpoint-group-filter
1a67fa47cf56489bf60f5b68f6c565e8bf2da701 says endpoint-group-filter
should reduce the size of the service catalog included in project
scoped tokens. But, currently, it doesn't, because we don't apply
endpoint_group filters on token catalog.

Change-Id: I0df9778eeee2a6722e4526b79d295c532b469e10
Closes-Bug: #1405574

commit_message:
supports lbaas alembic migration for db2

This patch adds the optional runtime dependency to support db2
for alembic migration, will not break the default mysql path.

This is needed for the IBM DB2 third party CI to work on this
project.

There will be a related patch in the main neutron project.

Change-Id: I9db112dbdc2d02df88ad676a6b21018f1d6f1724
Closes-Bug: 1442524

commit_message:
Return HTTPForbidden if over quota

According to following guide line
https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst
we should return HTTPForbidden instead of HTTPBadRequest
if the quota is over.

per
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html#f2
this doesn't need a microversion bump.

Change-Id: Ic72501fbe0a1c761890d498f483e99d106bd7804
Closes-Bug: 1451991

commit_message:
Update name validation with expanded characters

Based on the unicode chart, there are printable characters outside
of the 0xFFFF range. We should allow those printable characters
when creating flavors.
Unicode chart: http://www.unicode.org/Public/UCD/latest/charts/CodeCharts.pdf

Change-Id: Icb1af52d61def886ec115f3d883f5ac58132e7f7
Closes-Bug: #1499091

NOTE: we keep the inspector (client) auth URLs at v2.0 until it

This change should allow keystone v3 as a default in most cases.

commit_message:
Switch default keystone auth_uri to v3

NOTE: we keep the inspector (client) auth URLs at v2.0 until it
properly handles v3 support. See LP bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-inspector/+bug/1531236

This change should allow keystone v3 as a default in most cases.
Our goal is to move towards using a versionless keystone auth_uri but
some clients still don't support that yet either so for now we hard
code to /v3 (similar to v2.0).

Change-Id: I55518994bcea1c1b9067912baf32919b692fb0c2
(cherry picked from commit 32d600a2b61aaff430f3a3298f316d85bb6b2369)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-10 11:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_disk_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/exact_core_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/exact_ram_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_ram_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_core_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/exact_disk_filter.py'], 'message': 'Apply scheduler limits to Exact* filters

The DiskFilter, RamFilter and CoreFilter scheduler filters set the
resource limit on the HostState object during filtering. This is
later checked in compute during the claim, and used to enforce
the allocation ratios in a safe manner. The Exact* filters do not
set the resource limits, so scheduler race conditions can result
in multiple bare metal instances claiming a single host.

This change sets the resource limits on the HostState object in
the ExactCoreFilter, ExactDiskFilter and ExactRamFilter, ensuring
that only a single baremetal instance can claim a compute host.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_core_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_disk_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_ram_filter.py

Change-Id: I31d0331afc4698046a4568935a95f70f30e335dd
Partial-Bug: #1341420
Co-Authored-By: Will Miller <wmiller@cray.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3471cc8b74444d04348d8e6dbc9c980641d4b0bc)
'}]
commit_message:
Apply scheduler limits to Exact* filters

The DiskFilter, RamFilter and CoreFilter scheduler filters set the
resource limit on the HostState object during filtering. This is
later checked in compute during the claim, and used to enforce
the allocation ratios in a safe manner. The Exact* filters do not
set the resource limits, so scheduler race conditions can result
in multiple bare metal instances claiming a single host.

This change sets the resource limits on the HostState object in
the ExactCoreFilter, ExactDiskFilter and ExactRamFilter, ensuring
that only a single baremetal instance can claim a compute host.

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_core_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_disk_filter.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_exact_ram_filter.py

Change-Id: I31d0331afc4698046a4568935a95f70f30e335dd
Partial-Bug: #1341420
Co-Authored-By: Will Miller <wmiller@cray.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3471cc8b74444d04348d8e6dbc9c980641d4b0bc)

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-01-29 13:01:57.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/api/middleware/cache.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Encode headers to launch glance v2 on mod_wsgi

Some headers in v2 are unicode string and they cannot be
recognized by mod_wsgi. So encode all headers as utf-8 to allow
users to use glance under Apache mod_wsgi or other wsgi
frameworks.  v1 functionality already encoded headers as utf-8.

Change-Id: Ifa83ed3ab44a4b7f98e438c74d889a956703cf4a
'}]
commit_message:
Encode headers to launch glance v2 on mod_wsgi

Some headers in v2 are unicode string and they cannot be
recognized by mod_wsgi. So encode all headers as utf-8 to allow
users to use glance under Apache mod_wsgi or other wsgi
frameworks.  v1 functionality already encoded headers as utf-8.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1508880
Change-Id: Ifa83ed3ab44a4b7f98e438c74d889a956703cf4a

commit_message:
Catch iscsi VolumeDeviceNotFound when detaching

If exceptions are raised, nova-compute can't start
when executing _destroy_evacuated_instances.

Change-Id: I0a2877ec0f922d2bc9a742d1c2c2540a6b77e9ce
Closes-Bug: #1532657

commit_message:
Use imageutils from oslo.utils

We clean up oslo-incubator in 90ae25e38915cc502d9e9c52d59e8fb668a72ae1,
and sync imageutils to oslo.utis with unittest in version 3.1.
openstack/common/imageutils.py exists without unittest. Let's switch
to use oslo.utils' imageutils.

Change-Id: Iac3b221d7ad16c16866dc6b11f08afc473da9bc9

commit_message:
Check for service existance in capabilities API

We have to return 404 error code if requested backend
is not found and 502 if request failed with timeout.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ia392973121800278751642f0a22ee817b3a69b74
Closes-Bug: #1520077

commit_message:
Add check for listener's admin_state_up status

Add check for listener's admin_state_up status, so that
only listener which admin_state_up==True can be write to
the haproxy config file.

Change-Id: I4b27cb0638fbd7f8d59829e8ddce8e7387b5f390
Closes-Bug: #1533108

six.moves.urllib already covers the py2 and py3 compatibility issues

commit_message:
Clean up unnecessary import of urlparse module

six.moves.urllib already covers the py2 and py3 compatibility issues
of urlparse module, use six.moves.urllib.parse.urlparse is enough.

Change-Id: I785f4f872850e5d770fdcf4c0d3392be3978cc4a

This adds the single and multiple load balancer delete actions. A
load balancer must be in ACTIVE or ERROR state in order for the
delete action to be available. If a load balancer has a listener the
delete request will currently fail, but future work should allow for
the listener and any related resources to also be deleted.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I3902587089963318c49a969f343e5043d8bdaf50
'}]
commit_message:
Add delete load balancer actions

This adds the single and multiple load balancer delete actions. A
load balancer must be in ACTIVE or ERROR state in order for the
delete action to be available. If a load balancer has a listener the
delete request will currently fail, but future work should allow for
the listener and any related resources to also be deleted.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui

commit_message:
Isolate DSE2 tests from one another

Add a parameter to the DseNode constructor that is folded into the
oslo-messaging topic names to allow all tests to be completely
isolated from each other, even when run in parallel.

Modify tests to use that parameter.

Pull original test_dse_node into tests2 as well.

Change-Id: I5629e3426b83c57643296c41b81ee827087493be

commit_message:
glance: support relying on tags to extract image id

Deprecated amp_image_id option with the new amp_image_tag option.

Also switched devstack plugin to rely on the tag to update the image
used for new load balancers.

Implements: blueprint use-glance-tags-to-manage-image
Change-Id: Ibc28b2220565667e15ca2b2674e55074d6126ec3

commit_message:
RST directive to discover and generate drivers doc

This patchset introduces a new custom directive called 'drivers-doc'
which loads all available drivers under a given namespace and import
their respective docstring into the .rst document.

This patchset also contains some modification/addition to the
docstring of these drivers to make the final document complete.

Change-Id: Ib3df59fa45cea9d11d20fb73a5f0f1d564135bca
Closes-Bug: #1536218
Closes-Bug: #1536735

commit_message:
Add support for TERMINATED_HTTPS protocol

This adds support for the TERMINATED_HTTPS listener protocol when
creating a new listener. When this option is selected the SSL
Certificates tab is displayed after the Listener Details tab and
allows selecting one or more available certificates. The user must
have barbican available and authority to list certificates and
secrets. Certificate containers must be created in barbican before
they will be available when creating a listener.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: Ia9312fa865d85ca977c1daea347d97bd69e9c5ba

subject: Make TransportErrors more descriptive
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-29 21:44:13.000000000', 'files': ['zaqarclient/transport/http.py', 'zaqarclient/transport/errors.py'], 'message': 'Make TransportErrors more descriptive

Problems:

1. In some cases no information is provided for the CLI user when
these exceptions are raised:
https://github.com/openstack/python-zaqarclient/blob/master/zaqarclient/
transport/http.py#L30.
For example, try "openstack pool show unexisting_pool". You will see
just blank line. It is because the server returns no message in the 404
response body. And the user sees the blank line.

2. Most of the error responses from Zaqar have bodies in
title-description format. TransportErrors can only show descriptions
from these responses. It's better to include also titles in the
client's exception messages.

3. Some of the error responses from Zaqar are not in title-description
format, but still have some info in their bodies. It's better to include
this info to the client's exception message.

Solution:

This patch makes all exceptions in zaqarclient/transport/errors.py show
at least error response code. The patch TransportErrors properly gather
the info from Zaqar's error response bodies and show it.

Partial-Bug: 1542804

Change-Id: Ie2cc3081a5dd7c4f21c29bdf78a9bad76b515121
'}]
commit_message:
Make TransportErrors more descriptive

Problems:

1. In some cases no information is provided for the CLI user when
these exceptions are raised:
https://github.com/openstack/python-zaqarclient/blob/master/zaqarclient/
transport/http.py#L30.
For example, try "openstack pool show unexisting_pool". You will see
just blank line. It is because the server returns no message in the 404
response body. And the user sees the blank line.

2. Most of the error responses from Zaqar have bodies in
title-description format. TransportErrors can only show descriptions
from these responses. It's better to include also titles in the
client's exception messages.

3. Some of the error responses from Zaqar are not in title-description
format, but still have some info in their bodies. It's better to include
this info to the client's exception message.

Solution:

This patch makes all exceptions in zaqarclient/transport/errors.py show
at least error response code. The patch TransportErrors properly gather
the info from Zaqar's error response bodies and show it.

Partial-Bug: 1542804

Change-Id: Ie2cc3081a5dd7c4f21c29bdf78a9bad76b515121

easily.

commit_message:
Add the angular LBaaS V2 Edit Action for Listeners

This change implements the edit row action service for the listeners
table.  The edit action of a listener includes the ability to not
only edit the listener itself, but all resources underneath it in the
load balancer hierarchy.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I5fcb20eecbee580f9db5c71da5a2ec84a6f359f9

subject: Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 06:23:17.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ceilometer/rootwrap.conf'], 'message': 'Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs

I noticed that nova, neutron and cinder's rootwrap exec_dirs include
/usr/local/{sbin,bin} which is a standardised location for admins to
install non-distro executables, and these executables are no less
"trustworthy" than /usr/bin and friends.  See neutron and cinder's
rootwrap.conf (and probably others), and typical distro default values
for sudoers/secure_path for extremely similar precedents that all include
/usr/local/*bin.

See the same patch of nova for more information:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280052/1
And see I710cf142b834381c00e651cfc062299ae755c33f for brief discussion
of doing this via devstack before.

Change-Id: If5ed1d7d81fdac10fc2b1608aafe20833e0f2980
'}]
commit_message:
Add /usr/local/{sbin,bin} to rootwrap exec_dirs

I noticed that nova, neutron and cinder's rootwrap exec_dirs include
/usr/local/{sbin,bin} which is a standardised location for admins to
install non-distro executables, and these executables are no less
"trustworthy" than /usr/bin and friends.  See neutron and cinder's
rootwrap.conf (and probably others), and typical distro default values
for sudoers/secure_path for extremely similar precedents that all include
/usr/local/*bin.

See the same patch of nova for more information:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280052/1
And see I710cf142b834381c00e651cfc062299ae755c33f for brief discussion
of doing this via devstack before.

Change-Id: If5ed1d7d81fdac10fc2b1608aafe20833e0f2980

commit_message:
Implement base configuration for independent repository

The review updates the base repo for IRR functional testing.
The current test structure is a simple pass until actual tests
are created. This change also pulls in the updates from review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284896/11 This role will not
function without these changes.

Change-Id: I05809190c38b113bab1ac14616d3a2d51a58e22f
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Match python/ angular table styles

This patch unifies the Python and Angular table styles (there is no
reason for them to look drastically different).

- Clean up table header in _data_table.html
- Remove page_header styling for default theme, as it causes the angular
  panels to shift downwards on the page
- Removed styling workarounds from default themes
- Removed several chunks of angular specific scss code, including the
  'modern' class
- Removed the "Actions" header in python tables, to match Angular
- Removed duplicate 'no items to display' info in footer, when table is
  empty.
- Also fixes the Containers header, which was different to all the
  others

Closes-Bug: 1517081
Co-Authored-By: Diana Whitten <hurgleburgler@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id71aab6e8bbbcd1f7fa4d5575156e4d3c6aa990d

commit_message:
Support for abort an ongoing live migration

In Nova API microversion 2.24 there is a new operation which allows to
abort a running live migration.

This change is to enable this feature at the client side implementing a
new method to call the new nova API:
nova live-migration-abort <server_id> <migration_id>

Implements blueprint: abort-live-migration

Depends-On: I1ff861e54997a069894b542bd764ac3ef1b3dbb2

Change-Id: Ic2ead126e0cf48aa54a083e97cb9d1303a5a9bbd

commit_message:
Huawei: delete_snapshot need not return any value

Currently delete_snapshot return True or False to indicate
whether the snapshot is really deleted on the array. This
is useless and just write for unit tests. Now we will remove
the return value and add another unit test for delete_snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1549584
Change-Id: I17fea61e3c0f5565ab04bc82f172e638480f45dc

commit_message:
Assign ceph/public to Fuel Storage by default

In order to isolate Ceph data traffic from OpenStack
management traffic, move ceph/public from Management
to Storage network.

Change-Id: If08aa1d2f92e6cf05d5da60b1bbfeaa957b67f13
Closes-Bug: #1549522

subject: Increase scheduler_max_attempts on undercloud and make it configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 12:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/install.d/02-puppet-stack-config', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Increase scheduler_max_attempts on undercloud and make it configurable

Interaction between Nova and Ironic is subject to races. It may happen that
Nova scheduler picks the same Ironic node for several instances. Of course only
one instance ends up deployed, the other fail with the Conflict exception. This
would repeat until all nodes are deployed, provided that we do have enough
Ironic nodes. However, with the current scheduler_max_attempts being equal to 3,
we fail long before.

The proper fix to this issue is being worked on in Nova and will probably merge
in Newton. Until it's done we work around this issue by increasing
scheduler_max_attempts substantially from 3 to 30. This number is essentially
random, and is based on the observation that people prefer to deploy nodes in
bulks of 20-30. This value also become configurable via the
scheduler_max_attempts configuration variable.

The only downside is that the actual scheduling problems will take longer now.
For TripleO we have additional node checks in the deployment command, so it
should not hit us too often.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1310178

Change-Id: I1f357cd0e1afe9e8ef6fd4cc7cb32c7d1a09583a
(cherry picked from commit 4614c45213a4b2ce20ace7b3764ccda1fe3fd0fc)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase scheduler_max_attempts on undercloud and make it configurable

Interaction between Nova and Ironic is subject to races. It may happen that
Nova scheduler picks the same Ironic node for several instances. Of course only
one instance ends up deployed, the other fail with the Conflict exception. This
would repeat until all nodes are deployed, provided that we do have enough
Ironic nodes. However, with the current scheduler_max_attempts being equal to 3,
we fail long before.

The proper fix to this issue is being worked on in Nova and will probably merge
in Newton. Until it's done we work around this issue by increasing
scheduler_max_attempts substantially from 3 to 30. This number is essentially
random, and is based on the observation that people prefer to deploy nodes in
bulks of 20-30. This value also become configurable via the
scheduler_max_attempts configuration variable.

The only downside is that the actual scheduling problems will take longer now.
For TripleO we have additional node checks in the deployment command, so it
should not hit us too often.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1310178

Change-Id: I1f357cd0e1afe9e8ef6fd4cc7cb32c7d1a09583a
(cherry picked from commit 4614c45213a4b2ce20ace7b3764ccda1fe3fd0fc)

commit_message:
Deprecate domain driver interface methods

Now that domains are represented as projects as domains, we can
deprecate the domain driver methods by moving these to the V8
legacy driver interface. These methods are still supported so that
older drivers can continue to function.

Change-Id: Ic6d11f39cf069aa641ba2dfaf51ccacda72aec4c
Partially-Implements: blueprint reseller
